loans.name: Yawo Kouma

texts.fr:
Yawo Kouma est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse avec 02 enfants en charge.
Yawo Kouma travaille comme revendeur de prêt à porter depuis 2003. Il répond à la demande dans un quartier de la place après achat au marché de HEDZRANAWOE et au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Yawo Kouma a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des vestes, des chemises.
texts.en: Yawo Kouma is a 28-year old man. He is married to a saleswoman and is raising two children. He has been selling prêt-à-porter clothing in his area since 2003. He gets his supplies at the market in Hedzranawoe and the Lomé Grand Market. Yawo Kouma is requesting his first loan from WAGES so that he can buy some shirts and jackets for resale.

loans.use: to buy prêt-à-porter clothing for resale.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia has been operating a boutique business for the last 13 years in Kenyatta market, Nairobi city.  She is 38 years old and married to Jones. They have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add to her stock of trousers, blouses, skirts and sweaters

In the future, Cornelia hopes to expand her business and open a boutique in Southern Sudan.

loans.use: To add to her stock of trousers, blouses, skirts and sweaters

loans.name: Kinuthia

texts.en:
For the last seven years, Kinuthia has been buying and selling charcoal as his primary business and operating an electronics shop as his secondary business. He is 26 years old and married to Leah. They have been blessed with one child.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff. This is his first loan. He has been loaned KES.50,000. He intends to use the loan to buy repair tools for his electronics shop.

In future, Kinuthia hopes that both his businesses will be successful and his income will increase.

loans.use: To buy tools for electronic repairs.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Алишер умный, добросовестный и честный человек.  Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Алишер занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, такие как картошки, морковь, лук, помидоры и кукурузы. Алишер хочет, чтобы его дети выросли в хороших условиях семьи и стали образованными, честными и культурными людьми. Алишер хотел бы получит займ в размере 2500$ США для покупки семена и минеральных удобрений, который позволяет ему расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыл. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Alisher is a smart, conscientious and honest person.  He is a married and loving father of three children.  Alisher is involved in growing agricultural crops, such as potatoes, carrots, onions, tomatoes and corn.  Alisher wants his children to grow up in good family conditions and become educated, honest and well-mannered people.  Alisher wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2500 for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers, which will allow him to expand his business and obtain desired profits.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children who are still attending school. He is the only income provider of the family. He has 16 years of experience working as a construction contractor and has one full-time employee helping him with the work. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional tools and equipment. This will be his first Kiva loan and he is sure that it will help him fulfill his business objectives.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipment

loans.name: Fousseni

texts.fr:
Fousseni est un homme âgé de 24 ans. Il est célibataire. 
Fousseni travaille comme revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2005. Il vend aux clients dans un quartier de la place après achat au marché de Lomé. 
Fousseni a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huile, des cartons de spaghetti.
texts.en: Fousseni is an unmarried 24-year-old man.  He has worked as a reseller of general food products since 2005.  He sells to customers in a local neighborhood after buying his products at the market in Lomé.  Fousseni has requested his second loan with WAGES in order to buy bags of rice, cans of oil, and boxes of spaghetti.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in West Point, Liberia. She is 38 years old and has a third grade education. She is married to a police officer and has five children between eight and 24 years old. Some are in school and some live at home.

For the past five years Sarah has been selling slippers. The problem she is facing is a small inventory. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 LRD to buy more slippers to sell.

Sarah’s hope is to build a house and send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Badji

texts.fr:
Badji est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Il a 01 enfant.
Badji travaille comme revendeur de télévision, et de ventilateur depuis 2008. Il vend à ses clients dans un quartier de la place. Il achète les produits à LOME. 
Badji a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des télévisions, des CD, DVD, des radios.
texts.en:
Badji is a 34-year-old man who is married to a clothier. He has one child. 

Badji has been working as a retailer of televisions and electric fans since 2008. He makes his sales in a local district. He purchases his supplies in Lomé. 

Badji has requested his second loan at the micro-finance institution WAGES in order to buy televisions, CD's, DVD's, and radios.

loans.use: to buy televisions, CD's, DVD's, and radios

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three school-aged children.
  
He has been working as a construction contractor since 1991. Thanks to his good business reputation in the area, he was able to stick with multiple projects. To accomplish the work tasks, he hired one full-time employee. And today, Adel is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed tools and supplies. He feels positive about his business prospects and looks forward to working on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase needed tools and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer, aged 35, and married with 4 children aged 5-12. She has been in mixed farming for 12 years in her hometown of Kitale, Western Kenya. Her farm produces vegetables, tomatoes, and fruits.

Esther has requested a loan of 61,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow for 31,200 KES and to buy poultry birds for 30,000 KES. Esther says her poultry business has picked up well and will do much better with more birds. She adds that her first Juhudi loan helped her start the poultry business and that the second one will improve her family's living standard.

Esther says fluctuations in prices and animal diseases are the greatest challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zein

texts.en: Zein is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has owned a car repair shop since 1987. During those years, he was able to improve his skills and extend his knowledge in this occupation, but also suffered from bad work circumstances. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added tools and supplies for his business. He’s sure that with the new equipment, he will be able to better serve his customers.

loans.use: to purchase added tools and supplies for his business

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 37-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three school-aged children. Due to her husband’s limited income, Zeinab decided to start working as a private teacher from her home to provide the family with extra financial support. And today, Zeinab is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay her children’s school fees before the beginning of the new academic year. Her only goal is to allow her children to pursue their education properly.

loans.use: to pay her children’s school fees

loans.name: Diame

texts.fr: -Monsieur Diame  vit au Sénégal, il est âgé de 52 ans, il est marié sans enfant. Il évolue dans la maçonnerie et  la location des chambres et magasins. Monsieur Diame a choisit ces activités par nécessité afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins ; Ce qui lui plait le plus dans la maçonnerie, c’est sa capacité de faire face à la demande de plus en plus croissante de ses services. Il est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 400000 prévu pour effectuer les travaux de réfection d’une de ses maisons qu’il va mettre en location. Ce projet  lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus mensuels et de mieux satisfaire ses besoins d’ordre familial et personnel.
texts.en:
Mr. Diame lives in Senegal. He is 52 years old, married, and without children. He works in masonry and rents out rooms and stores. Mr. Diame chose these businesses by necessity in order to support himself. What he likes the most about masonry is the ability to meet the burgeoning demand for his services. 

He has been an associate of one of the U-IMCEC branches since April 2010. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for carrying out his renovation work for his houses that he will put up for rent. This project will enable him to increase his monthly revenues and to do better in meeting his own need and those of his family.

loans.use: to renovate a bedroom to rent out

loans.name: François

texts.fr:
François est né au Rwanda et a 34 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de primaire. 
François est aide maçon. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour louer un champ pour cultiver des pommes de terre. 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenues : l’agriculture, le taxi moto et un commerce de pièces de rechange. Dans les prochaines années, François voudrait moderniser ses agricultures et accroitre ses autres activités. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de son petit frère.
texts.en: François was born in Rwanda and is 34 years old. He is unmarried and without any children. He has a 3rd grade education. François is a mason's helper. This loan cycle is his third one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to lease a field for growing potatoes. His strategy for business growth is to have several sources of revenues: agriculture, moto taxi, and a spare parts business. In the next few years, François would like to modernize his farm work and to increase his other businesses. With the profits, he foresees covering the schooling costs for his younger brother.

loans.use: to lease a field for growing potatoes

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en: Nayef is a 24-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings. He has eight years of experience working as a plumber. Four years ago, he started to work independently. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools for his business. He is willing to work closely with multiple projects and needs to get ready to be in the requisition of the clients. Nayef hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 24 years old and a single mother of three children. 

Ruth has a grocery store. She has applied for her first loan of KES 5,000. She will use the money to buy more onions to add to her stock.

She hopes to own a food kiosk in the future.

loans.use: To buy onions to add to her stock.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children. In 2003, he started his own business selling a variety of Lebanese bread products. His delicious goods are well enjoyed by consumers. With his requested loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase a small van to help him distribute his products to customers located in different areas and villages. He intends to augment his business sales in order to gain superior income. In the future, he is planning to open his own bakery.

loans.use: to purchase a small van to help him distribute his products

loans.name: Coumba Mané

texts.fr: -Madame Coumba  est une femme mariée, âgé d’une cinquantaine d’année. Elle vit au Sénégal  et s’active dans la location des chambres. Elle a choisit son activité par nécessité afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins. Elle trouve beaucoup de plaisir à aider les gens à trouver un logement. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2000.Elle y a déjà remboursée trois prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 destiné à réaliser quelques travaux dans sa maison. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer l’état des chambres qu’elle met en location et  le cadre de vie chez elle. L’augmentation de ses besoins lui permettra de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et de mieux aider sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Coumba is a 50-something year old married woman who lives in Senegal. She is active in renting out rooms. She chose this business by necessity in order to support herself. She finds a great deal of joy in helping people find lodging. 

Ms. Coumba has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since April 2000. There, she has already repaid three previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 for completing some work in her house. This will enable her to improve the rooms that she rents out, as well as her living conditions at home. Increasing (her revenues) will allow her to meet her personnel needs and to help out her family further.

loans.use: to renovate a room to rent out

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is a 29-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and two school-aged children. In 2009, she started working as a private teacher receiving students at her home. She cooperates with her husband financially to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to prepare a special education room and equip it with the needed tools, tables, education wall etc. She is hoping to receive more students in the coming school season.

loans.use: to prepare a special education room and equip it with tools, tables, education wall etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Birame Bigué

texts.fr: -Monsieur Birame  est un jeune homme de 30 ans, il Habite au Sénégal. Il est célibataire. Il  gère un atelier de couture chez lui. IL a choisit son métier par amour ; mais aussi par  souci d’avoir une source de revenu qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins.IL est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2004. Il sollicite un prêt de 170 000. Ceci lui permettra d’acheter une machine à coudre afin de bien préparer la fête de Korité. Ainsi, son financement  l’aidera  à réaliser ses projets et à satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en: Mr. Birame is a young man, 30 years old. He lives in Senegal and is unmarried. He runs a tailoring shop in his home. He chose this trade for the love of it but also out of concern for having an income enabling him to support himself. He has been an associate of one of the U-IMCEC branches since 2004. He is requesting a loan of 170,000 francs which will allow him to buy a sewing machine, so as to be well-prepared for the holiday of Korité. Thus, his financing will help him to accomplish his projects and to meet his needs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 33 years old and lives in Congo Town. He is married and his wife is a businesswoman. They have three children who are between 2 and 7 years old. All of them are in school and live with their parents. For the past five years, he has been selling sporting materials like footballs, basketballs, and football boots among others. He is requesting a loan to purchase more sporting materials for his shop. He plans to build a bigger store in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more sporting materials for his shop

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 46-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife and four children. He has owned a car repair shop since 1993. He also sells car spare parts from his shop. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his purchases of new tools and added car spare parts. This will be his second Kiva loan and we note that he has a very good repayment history. In the future, he is planning to enlarge his shop and expand his business operation into other areas.

loans.use: to increase his purchases of new tools and car spare parts

loans.name: Kuña Aty Joaju Group

texts.es:
El Comité Kuña Aty Joaju está situado en la ciudad D. Curuguaty, conformado por 10 diez mujeres cada una cuenta con actividades económicas, las cuales se reúnen por la iniciativa D. una D. las miembros con el propósito D. constituirse en un comité comprometiéndose a trabajar en equipo, con responsabilidad, honestidad y comunicación. Ya que cada una D. ellas demostró conciencia del compromiso que están asumiendo. Ellas se encuentran en el primer ciclo.
La Señora Porfiria se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado salir adelante. Comenta que tiene mucha demanda, en especial los fines D. semana, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos. Desea poder ampliar su local, con lo cual podrá tener más mercaderías en su stock. Comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por el bien D. su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. vinos, cervezas, whiskys y demás para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Aty Joaju" committee is located in the city of Curuguaty.  It is maD. up of ten women, each of whom has their own economic activity.  They meet at the initiative of one of the members, with the goal of having a committee committed to working as a team, with responsibility, honesty and communication.  Each one of them has demonstrated awareness of the commitment that they are taking on.  They are in their first lending cycle/

Señora Porfiria works selling alcoholic beverages, and thanks to this work she has been able to get ahead in life.  She comments that she has good demand for her products, especially on the weekends, which earn her a very good income.  She wants to be able to expand her premises, which will allow her to have more merchandise in stock.  She comments that all her efforts are for the good of her family.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase wine, beer, whiskey and other items for subsequent sale.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it is giving her.

loans.use: to buy wine, beer, and whiskey for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old and married with three school-going children.

Mary has a shoe business that she runs and has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more shoes to add to her stock.

She hopes to open a boutique shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Zadock

texts.en:
Zadock is 32 years old and has been in farming in Kitale, Western Kenya, for 5 years with two farmhands. His farm produces maize, eggs, and vegetables. He is still single and earns additional income from pool table games in the town.

Zadock has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He says he has experience with the poultry business and that additional birds will ensure a better income. He hopes to grow his poultry business and venture into the dairy business. He says all of this will contribute to building a strong foundation for a future family.

Zadock says lack of financing is the greatest challenge to farmers. He adds that Juhudi Kilimo's loans are the best.

loans.use: To purchase birds for his poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional clothing) for her business,

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma has been operating her salon business and selling sodas for the last 14 years in Kenyatta market, Nairobi city. She is 32 years old and married with two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is her first loan. She intends to use the loan to buy seven crates of sodas and invest the rest in her salon

In the future, Salma hopes to expand her business and open a soda depot.

loans.use: To buy seven crates of sodas and invest the rest in her salon.

loans.name: Mouhamadou Bobo

texts.fr: -Monsieur Mouhamadou  est un habitant du Sénégal, âgé de 49 ans. IL est marié et  évolue dans le secteur de commerce depuis plusieurs années. Il gère une boutique dans la localité ou il vit. Il à choisit son activité par nécessité  pour subvenir à ses besoins personnels. Il est membre de l’U-IMCEC depuis  trois mois. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000. Son objectif consiste à augmenter son fond de roulement en achetant les produits qui lui permettront de renforcer son stock des marchandises afin de mieux développer son commerce. Son souhait est de s’assurer des revenus stables afin de pouvoir réaliser ses projets futurs et soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mouhamadou lives in Senegal and is 49 years old. He is married and has been working in commerce for several years. He runs a shop in the town where lives. He chose this business by necessity to support himself. 

Mr. Mouhamadou has been a member of the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC for three months. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs. His goal consists in increasing his working capital by buying goods enabling him to bolster his stock of merchandise. This is for developing his business further. His wish is to ensure stable revenues to accomplish future projects and to support his family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to be sold

loans.name: Jorum

texts.en:
For the last 19 years, Jorum has been operating a general shop in Emali town. He is 39 years old and married with three children.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. He has been loaned KES 50,000. This is his first loan. He intends to use the loan to add to his stock of cereals and fertilizers.

In the future, he aspires to diversify into farming to increase his income.

loans.use: To add to his stock of cereals and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika Savings Group A

texts.en: 35-year-old Eric has been overseeing operations at his pub business for the last five years. Pub businesses are all the rage now in Kampala. Most pubs are driving roaring businesses with the increasing population in Kampala. Eric, too, can attest to this, as his pub is in high favor with mostly the middle class demographic. He offers a variety of both hard and soft drinks. Eric says prior to starting this business, he was more involved in a poultry business. Monthly, he says, the pub business' gross sales income is a total of Uganda shillings 300,000. He says he intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more crates of both hard and soft drinks to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of hard and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya, and has been in mixed farming for 6 years producing maize, potatoes, beans, and millet. She is married with 4 children, aged 2-16, with the first 3 already in school. She runs a retail shop in the local market.

She has requested a first loan with Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming. She hopes the business will help her repay the loan, raise her family's living standard, and establish a processing machine for cereals in the local market.

Julia says animal feeds are usually a challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new products to increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, sugar and a new cooking gas cylinder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock to her shop and to increase livestock, like cows and sheep

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria  lives in Uganda.  She is widowed and has 8 children, none of whom is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grand children). Victoria has a business of poultry farming.  She has been in this business for 9 months, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Victoria sells her products from home, by means of retail.  Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feeds.

The main business challenges for Victoria include seasonality, thieves and  transportation of chicken feeds.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and also to own 2000 chicken. Victoria lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying for electricity bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre Santa Catalina se conformó gracias a que una D. las miembros oyó hablar del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras. Luego D. esto se unieron y se formaron, D. esto surgió el grupo. Actualmente se encuentran en el tercer ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Ellas se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, con mucha creatividad e ingenio. Luchan diariamente por el sustento D. sus familias.
La Señora Reina se dedica a la compra y venta D. todo tipo D. artículos, como ser sabanas, frazadas, ropas, calzados y demás. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran D. ella, y tiene mucha demanda con la que le gustaría cumplir. Uno D. sus proyectos es tener un local donD. pueda ofrecer sus mercaderías.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. sabanas, frazadas, zapatos y demás para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda, ya que le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina Women’s Committee was formed because one of its members heard about the program for women entrepreneurs.  After that the women got together and formed this group.  They’re currently in their third cycle in the program.

They define themselves as ingenious, creative, hardworking, entrepreneurial women who work daily to support their families.

Reina buys and sells all types of items, such as bed sheets, blankets, clothing, shoes, and other things.  She says that she has lots of customers who always buy from her and that she has lots of demand that she wants to meet.  One of her projects is to establish a location where she can offer her merchandise.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy sheets, blankets, shoes, and other items for resale.  She appreciates the Foundation for the opportunity which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy inventory for resale

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is 33 years old.  He is from Migori and is married, with two children.

Tobias runs a barber shop and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a shaving machine. The profits made from this business will be used for his family's needs.

He hopes to expand his business and open another barber shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy another shaving machine.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sister and her children).  Esther has a business of a food stall . She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Esther sells her products at the market. 

Esther has requested  for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Esther include seasonality, thieves and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to  sell at wholesale only and  to start going to villages for food staffs.    Esther lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava and  Irish potatoes

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika Savings Group B

texts.en:
Agnes, 35 years old, has a decade-long pedigree in her food sales trade in Kampala. She says she set forth in this business under the financial auspices of her husband, with whom she has two high-spirited children.  She had previously been a housewife.  She sells foods such as bananas, sweet potatoes, green vegetables, pineapples, cassava, Irish potatoes and beans.

What has kept her business afloat is the fact that she plies her business in one of the cheapest and most popular food markets in the metropolis of Kampala in Uganda. This food market is highly popular and any entrepreneur who plans out effectively and serves his clientele well can do great business.

Monthly, Agnes's gross sales income is Uganda shillings 120,000.  She says this loan will come in handy in the purchase of more foods, such as bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beans, pineapples, etc., to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more foods such as bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beans, pineapples, etc., to resell

loans.name: Celia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Mocambique, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 16 anos de idade que frequenta a 10ª classe. Fez 9ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante ha bastante tempo,onde vende produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo em outros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, batata, amendoim, refrescos, sumos, massa, e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria e obter mais lucros. O primeiro emprestimo foi de : 15.000.00mt.
Pretende ampliar o seu negocio construindo um estabelecimento comercial maior, assim pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Celia was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has a 16-year-old son who attends tenth grade. Celia finished ninth grade and did not continue with school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has never left her hometown. For quite some time Celia has been a businesswoman selling various products, and she has an income of around 4,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Celia's second Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy products (rice, potatoes, peanuts, soft drinks, pasta and other items) in order to increase her inventory and earn more profit. The first loan was for 15,000 meticais.

She intends to expand her business by building a larger store, so she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (rice, potatoes, peanuts, soft drinks, juices, pasta, etc.).

loans.name: Maria H

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manhiça, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais todos frequentam a escola. Fez o nivel superior e parou por falta de tempo. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu da sua terra natal para Maputo em missão de serrviço, é professora ha mais de 16 anos na escola primaria completa de salinas, e tem um salário de 13.133.29mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já fez emprestimo no BIM no valor de 30.000.00mt para dar inicio a sua obra,o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma colega que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de constrção DE UMA CASA (areia, barrotes, cimento, ferro, pedra, e outros) para dar continuidade a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.300.00mt, e 10.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt.
Pretende concluir a sua casa,mobiliar para melhor confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Manhiça, in the southern Mocambican province of Maputo. She is a single mother of 3 children who all go to school. Maria started higher level studies but left without completing them due to other time pressures. She lives in her own home with her family and she does not support anyone else.
She left her home town and came to Maputo in search of work. She has been a teacher for 16 years at the salt works' full primary school; she earns a monthly salary of 13,133.29MTs which covers her household expenses and leaves a little for her to save in her Millennium BIM bank account. 
She has previously borrowed 30,000MTs from the Millennium BIM bank to start her project. She repaid this with ease. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a Hluvuku client. This is her third loan with this institution, for 20,000MTs, which Maria will use to buy building materials for her house (sand, beams, cement, iron, stone and other materials) in order to carry on with the work. Her previous loans were for 8,300MTs, 10,000MTs and 15,000MTs.
Maria wants to finish building her house and furnish it so that her family will be comfortable. She intends to apply for further Hluvuku loans for this purpose.

loans.use: to build a house (to purchase sand, beams, cement, iron, stone and other materials).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials (sand, breeze blocks, boards, iron, stone and other materials).

loans.name: Blanca Ines

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 23 años es soltera y vive con sus padres y un hijo que tiene 1 año; recide en Cotacachi a 15 minutos de Otavalo. Blanca se describe como una perosna trabajadora, muy exigente le gusta que las cosas le salgan bien.

Trabaja sola en la crianza de animales (pollos,cerdos) para su venta.Es la primera vez que le solicita créditos a FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de cerdos lo cual le ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida junto con su hijo y sus padres.

Su sueño es incrementar su negocio para poder dar trabajo a las personas que necesitan.
texts.en:
Blanca is 23, single and lives with her parents and a son, who is 1 year old. She lives in Cotacachi, 15 minutes from Otavalo. Blanca is described as a hardworking  and very demanding person who likes things to go well.

She works alone raising animals (chickens, cows) for sale. This is the first loan she has requested from FODEMI. She will use it to buy pigs, which will help her to increase her income thereby improving her quality of life along with that of her son and parents.

Her dream is to expand her business so that she will be able to give work to those who need it.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary a married mother of five children, all of whom are in school, lives in Uganda in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

For the past six years Rosemary has had a tailoring business. Working seven days a week, she sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Rosemary has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more clothing materials. Her main business challenges include seasonality and thieves, and her goal is to own a tailoring school.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials.

loans.name: Maria G. B

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manhiça, provincia de Maputo, sul de Mocambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais todos frequenta a escola. Frequenta o 1º ano de faculdade pedagogica, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro para ajudar com as dispesas alimentares. 
Saiu da sua terra natal em missão de serviço, é professora ha mais de 16 anos na escola primaria 4 de outubro, localizada em Boane, provincia de Maputo e tem um salário de cerca de 6.800.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Fez emprestimo na C.C.P da Matola no valor de 5.000.00mt destinado ao inicio da sua obra DA SUA CASA,o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades nenhumas. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, chapas,  ferro, pedra, e outros) para dar continuidade a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt ,também para habitação.
Pretende concluir a sua casa, e contruir um murro para a maior segurança da sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Manhiça, in the southern Mozambican province of Maputo. She is a single mother of 3 children who all attend school. Maria is in her first year of teacher training. She lives in her own home with her family and she also supports her mother, sending her money to help with her food costs.
She left her home town in search of work, and she has been teaching at the '4 de Outubro' (4th of October) primary school in Boane, in Maputo, for 16 years. She earns around 6,800MTs each month which covers her household expenses and allows her to save a little in her Millennium BIM bank account.
She previously borrowed 5,000MTs from CCP Matola (another microfinance institution) which she used to begin the work on her house. She repaid this without difficulty. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a Hluvuku client. This is Maria's fourth loan with this institution, for 15,000MTs, which she wants to use to buy building materials (sand, sheeting, iron, stone and other materials) so that she can continue with her project. Her first two loans were both for 10,000MTs and her third was for 12,000MTs, and were also used on her home.
Maria wants to finish building her house, then she wants to build a wall to keep her family safe. She intends to apply for other loans with Hluvuku to achieve this aim.

loans.use: to buy building materials (sand, sheeting, iron, stone and other materials).

loans.name: Tecoporave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Asunción, 13 amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad se unen, de lo que surge el comité denominado Tecoporave Rekavo, el cual se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de generar ingresos para sus familias, además de eso ven en esto una oportunidad de crecimiento, no solo en el sentido económico, sino también en lo personas.
La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles, según comentarios de la misma tiene muy buena clientela, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos. Dice que muchas personas gustan de las comidas que ella prepara, ya que tiene muy rica sazón. Uno de sus sueños es tener un comedor, donde pueda deleitar a más personas con los alimentos que prepara.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, lácteos, panificados y otros insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que prepara.
texts.en:
In the city of Asunción, 13 friends and neighbours from the city join forces, from which is born the communal bank called Tecoporave Rekavo. Tecoporave Rekavo is currently in its 4th cycle of the program run by Fundación Paraguaya for enterprising women. They joined forces for the purpose of generating income for their families. In addition, they also see it as an opportunity for growth, not only in the economic sense but also at the personal level.

Mrs Maria sells food. She herself says that she has a very good client base which generates a very good income. She says that a lot of people like the food she prepares, as it is very tasty. One of her dreams is to own a diner where more people can enjoy the food she prepares.

She is asking for a loan to buy meat, seasonings, dairy products, bakery items and other such necessary items to produce the food she makes.

loans.use: to buy meat, dairy products and bakery items used to prepare the food she make.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials (beams sheeting, boards, iron, stone and other materials).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To puchase poultry birds and construct poultry unit

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manhiça, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais todos frequenta a escola. Fez a 5ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante ha bastante tempo onde vende produtos diversos,e tem um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (batatas, peixe, arroz, amendoim, massa, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende contruir um estabelecimento comercial para ampliar a sua actividade comercial, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alice was born in Manhiça, in the southen Mozambican province of Maputo. She is a married mother of 6 children who all attend school. Alice attended school up to the 5th Grade but left due to her financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has never lived outside of her home town. She has been running her own business for some time, selling a range of products, from which she earns a monthly salary of around 10,000MTs. This covers for household expenses and allows her to save a little in her Millennium BIM bank account.

She has never borrowed money from other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a Hluvuku client. This is Alice's first loan with this institution, for 10,000MTs; she wants to use this to buy food products (potatoes, fish, rice, peanuts, pasta and other items) in order to increase her stock levels.
Alice wants to expand her business by building premises, and she intends to apply for further loans with Hluvuku to achieve this aim.

loans.use: to buy and sell food (potatoes, fish, rice, peanuts, pasta and other products).

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Cabo Delgado, norte de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais todos frequentam a escola. Nunca frequentou a escola por falta de condições financeiras, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal a procura de melhores condiçoes de vida, é pencionista ha mais de 7 anos recebendo a sua pensão e a do marido após a sua morte no ano de 2004 ,e tem um rendimento de cerca de 7.400.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção DE UMA CASA PARA HABITACAO(barrotes, pranchas, areia, cimento, e outros) para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Pretende concluir a sua obra para oferecer mais conforto a su familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku
texts.en:
Lucia was born in Cabo Delgado Province in northern Mozambique. She is widowed and has five children who all go to school. Lucia never attended school because she did not have enough money. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left her hometown looking for better living conditions. She has been a pensioner for more than seven years, receiving her husband's pension after his death in 2004. Her income is about 7,400 meticais per month; she uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Lucia has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is her first Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy construction materials for her home (beams, planks, sand, cement and other items) so she can continue building.

She intends to finish her house so she can make her family more comfortable, so she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy home construction materials (beams, planks, sand, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for home construction (stones, beams, sand, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Panda, provincia de Inhambane , sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 1 filho que frequenta a  escola. Frequenta o 1º ano de faculdade no instituto industrial e comercial armando emilio guebuza. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seu pai que vive com ele. 

Saiu da sua terra natal ainda pequeno na companhia dos seus pais, é eletrecista ha mais de 8 anos e tem um salario de cerca de 9.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material PARA CONSTRUCAO DA SUA CASA(blocos, areia, cimento, e outros) para dar continuidade a sua obra. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt para iniciar a sua obra.
Pretende concluir a sua obra para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia e concluir os estudos, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jose was born in Panda, which is in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has one son who goes to school. Jose is in the first year at the Instituto Industrial e Comercial Armando Emilio Guebuza (Armando Emilio Guebuza Industrial and Business Institute). He lives in his own house with his family and supports his father, who lives with him.

When he was still young, Jose left his hometown with his parents. He has been an electrician for more than eight years and has a salary of about 9,500 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

He has never had loans from other banks and learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Jose's second Hluvuku loan. He is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials for his house (blocks, sand, cement and other items) so he can keep building. The first loan was for 10,000 meticais and was used to start construction.

Jose intends to finish his house and make his family more comfortable. He also intends to finish his studies, so he will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy materials for home construction (blocks, sand, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manjacaze, provincia de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 8 filho dos quais  6 frequentam a  escola e 2 ainda não tem idade escolar. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus irmãs enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas dispesas. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante ha mais de 20 anos e dedica-se a compra e venda de produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 2.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (peixe, batata, sumos, arroz, amendoim, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 15.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 10.000.00mt, ambos para o comercio.
Pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial, e iniciar a obra da sua residência para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jeremias was born in Manjacaze, Gaza province, in southern Mozambique, is married and father of eight children, six of whom attend school and the other two are still not in school age. After completing fourth grade, he dropped out of school for lack of financial possibilities. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his sister by sending money to help with expenses. 
He has never left his homeland and he has been running a business for now twenty years; he buys and sells various products and he make a profit of about 2.500.00mt a month, that he uses for household expenses and saves something in his bank account (BIM). 
He had never requested a loan by other banks until he met Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his fourth loan by Hluvuku, of the amount of 15.000.00mt  to be used to purchase products (fish, potatoes, juices, rice, peanuts, and others) to increase his supply stock. The previous loans were 15.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt and 10.000.00mt, all of them used for his business. 
He intends to expand his business and to refurbish his house to offer more comfort to his family, so in the future he will request further loans by Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods to resell (fish, potatoes, juices, rice, peanuts and others)

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 18 años vive en Cotacachi con sus padres. Jorge se considera una persona alegre, tranquilo y divertido con sus amigos.

Trabaja con su padre en la siembra de tomates de árbol y en la crianza de cerdos, en la siembra de tomates empezó hace 7 meses y los cerdos tiene desde que era niño.

Es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMI, el préstamo que solicita es para la compra de abono por quintales para su tomate y también lo va a utilizar para la compra de cerdos.

Con esta inversión mejorará la calidad del tomate y podrá mejorar sus ingresos que le ayudará a terminar la casa de sus padres.

Su sueño es crecer económicamente para poder reingresar a los estudios ya que se retiró por falta de dinero.
texts.en:
Jorge is 18 and lives in Cotacachi with his parents. He is considered to be a happy, easygoing and entertaining person by his friends.

He works with his father planting tamarillos [tree tomatoes] and raising pigs. He began planting tamarillos 7 months ago but he has been raising pigs since he was a child.

This is the first time he has worked with FODEMI and he will use the loan to buy fertilizer by the quintales [units of weight equal to approximately 220 lbs or 100 kilograms] for the tamarillos and also to buy pigs.

With this investment, he will improve the quality of the tamarillos and will be able to increase his income, which will help to complete construction on his parent’s home.

His dream is for continued economic growth so that he will be able to go back to his studies since he had to leave school due to a lack of money.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for tree tomatoes and to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos dos quais  apenas 1 frequenta a  escola e o outro ainda não tem idade escolar. Frequenta a 10ª classe, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua avó que vive com ele. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é Jardineiro do hospital central de Maputo ha mais de 3 anos e dono de um negocio de venda de produtos alimentares diversos onde  tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.700.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já fez emprestimo no BIM 26.000.00mt destinado a legalização do seu terreno, o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (peixe, batata, sumos, arroz, amendoim, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende contruir sua casa pra ofercer conforto a sua familia, e concluir os estudos, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Pedro was born in Maputo, a city in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has two children; one attends school and the other is not school age yet. Pedro is in tenth grade. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his grandmother, who lives with him.

He has never left his hometown. Pedro has worked as a gardener at Maputo's central hospital for more than three years, and he owns a business selling various foods. His income is around 4,700 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account (at BIM).

He had a 26,000 meticais loan from BIM to buy title to his land, and he paid off the loan without any trouble. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Pedro's first Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (fish, potatoes, juices, rice, peanuts and other items) to increase his inventory.

He intends to finish his studies and to build a house so he can make his family more comfortable. To do these things, he will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (fish, potatoes, juices, rice, peanuts, etc.).

loans.name: Ceonaldo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 1 filho que ainda não tem idade escolar. Fez a 7ª classe e parou para assumir a responsabilidade como pai, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua mãe e seu irmão que vivem com ele. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é trabalhador do comite olimpico ha mais de 3 anos e  tem um salário de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção DE UMA CASA PARA HABITACAO(pedra, barrotes, cimento, areia, e outros) para continuar com a sua obra.
Pretende concluir sua casa, e mobiliar pra ofercer conforto a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ceonaldo was born in Boane, which is in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has a son who is not old enough to go to school yet. Ceonaldo finished seventh grade and quit school to take on his responsibilities as a father. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother and brother, who live with him.

He has never left his hometown. Ceonaldo has worked for the Olympic Committee for more than three years and earns about 3,000 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

He has never had loans from other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Ceonaldo's first Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 12,000 meticais to buy construction materials (stone, beams, cement, sand and other items) so he can continue building his house.

He intends to finish the house and furnish it to make his family more comfortable, so he will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy home construction materials (stone, beams, cement, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Chadreque

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteiro e pai de 1 filha que ainda não tem idade escolar. Frequenta o 4º ano da  universidade pedagogica de gestão e administração. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua mãe e seu pai enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas de agua e energia. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é professor ha mais de 8 anos e é do quadro MEC (Ministerio da Educação e Cultura) e tem um salário de cerca de 8.200.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Fez emprestimo na PROCREDIT e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu sétimo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção DE UMA CASA (pedra, barrotes, cimento, areia, e outros) para continuar com a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 4.800.00mt, 5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt,e 2.500.00mt,  ambos para a sua obra.
Pretende ampliar a sua casa, e contruir um estaleiro, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Chadreque was born in Boane, which is in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is single and has a daughter who is not old enough to go to school. Chadreque is in the fourth year of Management and Administration at the Universidade Pedagogica (Pedagogical University). He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother and father by sending money to pay their water and energy bills.

He has never left his hometown. For more than eight years he has been a teacher and a MEC (Ministry of Education and Culture) employee. His salary is around 8,200 meticais per month, and he uses it for household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account (at BIM).

Chadreque had a loan with ProCredit and was able to pay it off without any problems. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Chadreque's seventh Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 13,000 meticais to buy construction materials (stone, beams, cement, sand and other items) so he can continue building his house. The previous loans were for 4,800 meticais, 5,000 meticais, 8,000 meticais, 6,000 meticais, 7,000 meticais, and 2,500 meticais. They were all for his house.

He intends to expand his house and build a sales stall, so he will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy home construction materials (stone, beams, cement, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Sonia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da M., provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos dos quais um frequenta a escola e o outro ainda não tem idade escolar. Fez a 8ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seu sobrinho que vive com ela. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante ha mais de 8 anos onde dedica-se a compra e venda de óleo, e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar óleo para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende contruir um estabelecimento comercial para aumentar a divercidade dos seus produtos e obter mais lucros, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Sonia was born in the city of M. in Maputo province in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of 2 children, one of whom goes to school while the other is past school age. She made it through the 8th grade and dropped out due to financial hardship. She lives in her own home with her family and takes care of her nephew who also lives with them.    

She has never left her homeland and has been in business for over 8 years buying and selling cooking oils. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 Mozambique Meticais (MZN) which she uses to cover her household expenses and some of which she saves in her personal bank account (BIM). She has never taken out a loan from another bank. 

She came to know Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through a friend who is also a Hluvuku client. This 13,000 MZN loan will be her first with Hluvuku and she intends to use it to buy cooking oil in order to offer a greater quantity of merchandise. She intends to build a store in order to offer a greater variety of products and increase her profits. Therefore, she plans to request future loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy and sell cooking oils.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis was born in the Dominican Republic, but came to the United States for the opportunity to live a better life and build a business. Less than a year ago, he founded an organization that provides non-food products to hospitality businesses, educational institutions and restaurants. Luis is the owner, partner and only employee, and operates business from home. He also works full-time as an IT professional at a shipping management company.

Luis is still in the early stages of forming his business and is now working on advertisements and visits to local hospitality establishments on weekends in order to get the word out about his unique services. He is committed to provide products to the hospitality industry quickly and inexpensively. 

He will use the loan to buy inventory as well as a desktop computer and a laptop to expedite orders. Luis also plans to invest in accounting software in order to manage sales and profits more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy inventory, a desktop computer and laptop to use the field.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
El Señor Aurelio tiene 42 años, vive con la señora Blanca y tienen 4 hijos. Es comerciante desde hace más de 15 años, vende todo tipo de artículos, como ser calzados, ropas, sabanas, edredones. Realiza sus ventas en forma directa y también en forma de pedidos en las zonas aledañas de la ciudad.
Debido a los años que lleva en este trabajo, el ha logrado formarse una clientela bien definida, a quienes visita en forma permanente dependiendo de la zona en que le toque trabajar. Uno de sus proyectos es expandirse y poder llegar a más ciudades de las que llega.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, ropas, calzados y otros para la posterior venta. Con esto podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Aurelio, 42, lives with Blanca and has 4 children.  He has been working as a retailer for more than 15 years, and he sells all types of items including: shoes, clothing, bed sheets and comforters.  He makes his sales directly and also through advance orders in the neighborhoods surrounding the city.  

Because he has been doing this work for years, he has formed a well-defined clientele, who visit on an ongoing basis depending on the neighborhood where he is working.  One of his plans is to expand so that he can travel to more areas than the ones he already frequents.  

He is requesting a loan to buy bed sheets, blankets, clothing, shoes and other items to later sell.  With this loan, he will be able to stock up his business and fulfill his customer's orders.  He thanks the Fundación for the opportunity that they are providing him.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, blankets, shoes, and other items to later sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años vive en unión libre con su mujer y sus dos hijos que tienen 4 y 2 años, los mismos que viven en Cotacachi a 15 minutos de Otavalo;Carlos se considera como una persona tranquila que le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia.

Trabaja con su mujer en la siembra de tomates de árbol por el tiempo de 1 año aproximadamente. Es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de abono para el sembrío de los tomates de árbol.

La compra de este abono mejorará la calidad del tomate de la misma manera mejorarán sus ventas.

Su sueño es comprar terrenos para sembrar y tener buenos ingresos económicos para que sus hijos tengan un buen estudio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 and lives with his common law wife and their two children, who are 4 and 2 years old. They live in Cotacachi, 15 minutes from Otavalo. He is considered to be an easygoing person who enjoys working so that his family will get ahead.

Carlos has been working with his wife planting tamarillos [tree tomatoes] for approximately one year. This is the first time he has worked with FODEMI and he is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer for the sown fields of tamarillos.

Purchase of the fertilizer will improve the quality of the tamarillos and in this way he will increase his sales.

His dream is to buy more land to cultivate and to have a good income so that his children will have a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his tree tomatoes.

loans.name: Oklunon We Lingbohoto Che Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTO CHE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des soeurs, et qui mènent des activités complémentaires. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Reine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Reine est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Reine est mariée à un électronicien du nom de Florien. Le couple à trois enfants,tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Reine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Reine vend du pétrole et des mèches. Reine s’approvisionne au Nigéria Etat voisin  du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Reine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTO CHE, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTO CHE is composed of three persons who are sisters who have complementary businesses. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Reine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to an electrician by the name of Florien. They have three children, who are all in school and in their care. Reine lives with together with her husband and children. 

To support herself and her children, Reine sells kerosene and hair extensions. She gets her supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Reine and the other members of the group OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTO CHE are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy kerosene and hair extensions

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika Savings Group C

texts.en:
Retailing is his business occupation. 12 years experience in this business for 29-year-old David has brought him to terms with many requisite facts about retailing. He has also solidified his insight in the fundamentals of elevating a business's prospects. David says he set forth in this business with a pep talk from close acquaintances.

He was prior to this, more partial to a charcoal sales business, which he still operates. David is, on the face of it, an assiduous, affable and good-natured gentleman who sees much on the horizon for his business. He envisages better prospects in the aftermath of using this Kiva loan. His monthly gross sales revenue is to the tune of Uganda shillings 180,000.

David says this loan will lend him countenance in the purchase of more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc to resell

loans.name: Adjeniya Dandji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ADJENIYA DANDJI est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adjaratou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adjaratou est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Adjaratou est mariée à un matelassier du nom de Saka. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adjaratou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Adjaratou vend des produits cosmétiques et des vêtements tout cousus à son domicile. Adjaratou s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Adjaratou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ADJENIYA DANDJI, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group ADJENIYA DANDJI is composed of three persons who live in the same district. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Adjaratou, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a mattress maker by the name of Saka. They have four children, who are all in school and in their care. 

To support herself and her children, Adjaratou sells cosmetics and ready-to-wear clothing out of her home. She gets her supplies from Benin and in Togo. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Adjaratou and the other members of the group ADJENIYA DANDJI are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Mahudjro-Ac2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO-AC2 est composé de trois personnes qui mènent des activités communes. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de  ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Emilienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Emilienne est âgée de 32 ans et vit au  Bénin. Emilienne est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Jean. Le couple à deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Emilienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Emilienne vend des produits cosmétiques. Emilienne s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Emilienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO-AC2, un deuxième crédit. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group MAHUDJRO-AC2 is composed of three persons who have businesses in common. This is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Emilienne, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a welder by the name of Jean. They have two children, who are both in school and in their care. Emilienne lives with together with her husband and children. 

To support herself and her children, Emilienne sells cosmetics. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Emilienne and the other members of the group MAHUDJRO-AC2 are requesting a second loan. The first loan was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Barika

texts.fr:
Barika est une femme  âgé(e) de 27 ans. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est un chauffeur. Elle a 2 enfants.  
Barika travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle est revendeuse de sacs pour les élèves, de femmes et voyageurs. Elle achète les produits  au marché local de hedzranawoé et travaille seule. 
Barika a requis son troisième (3ème) crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs d’écoliers, de femmes, et de voyage.
texts.en:
Barika is a 27-year-old woman who is married to a driver. She has two children.

Barika has been working as a retailer since 2005. She sells bags for students, women, and travelers. She purchases her supplies at the local market of Hedzranawoé and works alone. 

Barika has requested her third loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES in order to buy school bags, handbags, suitcases, shoulder bags, etc.

loans.use: to buy bags

loans.name: Kokouvi Ely

texts.fr:
Kokouvi Ely est un homme âgé de 31 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 01 enfant. 
Kokouvi Ely travaille comme infirmier mais à cette activité il ajoute l’activité de meunier depuis 2008.
 Il a installé son moulin  dans un quartier du pays. Il achète les outils à Lomé et il est aidé par  01 personne.
Kokouvi Ely a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter de la dynamo et la tête de moulin.
texts.en:
Kokouvi Ely is a 31-year-old man who is married to a retailer. He has one child. 

Kokouvi Ely works as a nurse, but in addition to this work, he has been a miller since 2008. He set up his mill in a district in this nation. He buys his tools from Lomé and has the help of one person.

Kokouvi Ely has requested his first loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES to buy a generator and some parts for his mill.

loans.use: to buy a generator and parts for a mill

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Akouavi est une femme âgé(e) de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un mécanicien. Elle a un enfant,.  
Akouavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010. Elle achète et revend des produits d’alimentation générale pour sa clientèle composée de toute personne. Elle achète les produits à dans les marchés locaux de lomé. Elle est la seule impliquée dans son commerce. 
Akouavi a requis ce crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 4 bidons d’huile, 2 sacs de riz, 2 sacs d’haricots, 1 carton de tomates, 2 cartons de sucre, 1 carton de papier hygiénique,3 cartons de poulet, 2 cartons de poissons.
texts.en:
Akouavi is a 37-year old woman. She is married to a mechanic. She has one child.
Akouavi has been working as  a vendor since 2010. She buys grocery products and resells them to the general public. She stocks up at the local markets of Lomé. She is the only person involved in her business.

Akouavi has requested this loan from WAGES in order to buy four jugs of oil, two bags of rice, two bags of beans, one box of tomatoes, two boxes of sugar, one box of toilet paper, three boxes of chicken, and two boxes of fish.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Gmtb-Djeffa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GMTB-DJEFFA est composé de neuf personnes qui sont des artisans et qui mènent des activités communes au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Tadagbé Augustin est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Tadagbé est âgé de 46 ans et est mariée à une revendeuse du nom de Yvette. Le couple a quatre enfants  tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Tadagbé Augustin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Tadagbé Augustin a appris la maçonnerie. A côté de cette activité Tadagbé Augustin fait l'élevage des porcs. Tadagbé Augustin mène cette activité depuis dix ans. Tadagbé Augustin s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Tadagbé Augustin sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GMTB-DJEFFA, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The nine members of the GMTB-DJEFFA are artisans who work together in Benin. This is the first time that the group has asked for assistance from ALIDé, in order to increase their level of activity. 

The group's representative, Tadagbé Augustin, is standing in the photo, with his hand raised. He is 46 years old and married to a retailer named Yvette. The couple has four children, all of whom have received schooling and are in their care. Tadagbé Augustin lives with his wife and four children. Household expenses are taken care of by the couple. In order to meet these expenses, Tadagbé Augustin learnt the trade of masonry. Alongside this, he raises pigs - an activity that he began 10 years ago. He obtains his supplies in Benin. In order to satisfy his customers and to increase his turnover and income, Tadagbé Augustin, along with the other group members, is requesting a loan for the first time.

loans.use: to buy accessories for masonry.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan tiene 33 años vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en Otavalo. Juan se describe como una persona alegre, dinamica y sociable.

Trabaja con un ayudante 6 años en el taller de cerrajería en llaves. Trabaja con Fodemi desde el año 2010, elcrédito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de materia prima, para abastecer su negocio que le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos lo cual le ayudará para poderles dar el estudio a sus hijos.
