Saiu da sua terra natal quando contraiu matrimonio, é agricultora ha mais de 16 anos e explora grandes hectares de terra, e  tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Fez emprestimo na PROCRIDIT e na SOCREMO para investir na sua actividade e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com qual pretende aplicar na sua actividade (COMPRA DE  sementes de feijão e milho).
Pretende comprar um trator para aumentar o nível de produção e obter mais lucros, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Magude, province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique, is a widow and mother of 7 children, 1 of which attends school whilst the others now have families of their own. She never had the opportunity to study due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left her birth-town when she got married, has been a famer for more than 16 years and works on large hectares of land with an income of around 6,500 meticals (MZN) per month which she uses for household expenses and saves in her bank account.

Maria has had loans with PROCRIDIT and SOCREMO which she invested in her activities and managed to pay off without difficulties. She learned of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 10,000 MZN which she intends to apply to her activity (purchasing bean and corn seeds).

She intends to purchase a tractor to increase the levels of production and obtain more profits and as such will solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase agricultural raw materials (bean and corn seeds)

loans.name: Sanda

texts.pt:
Nasceu  na cidade de Maputo,  provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteira  e  mãe  de 3 filhos  dos  quais  todos  frequentam  a  escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou porque foi ao lar cedo e nunca mais teve oportunidade de retomar os estudos. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante ambulante ha mais de 6 anos e dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos, e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( amendoim, arroz, caldo,oleo, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, para mesma actividade.
Pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial, construindo um estabelecimento onde possa expor os seus produtos, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
S. was born in Maputo, a city in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has three children; two of them go to school. S. finished seventh grade and quit school because she started her own household early and never had the opportunity to go back to her studies. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has never left her hometown. For more than six years S. has been a street vendor selling a variety of products, and she earns about 5,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is S.'s second Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 12,000 meticais to buy products (peanuts, rice, broth, oil and other items) to increase her inventory. The first loan was for 10,000 meticais and was used for the same purpose.

She intends to expand her business by building a store where she can display her products, so she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Rita

texts.pt:
Nasceu  em Vilanculos,  provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, viuva  e  mãe  de 2 filhos  dos  quais  todos  frequentam  a  escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua cunhada que vive com ela. 

saiu da sua terra natal a procura de melhores condições de vida, é negociante ha mais de 2 anos e dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos, e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( amendoim, arroz, sumos,oleo, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende construir uma mercearia para ampliar a sua actividade comercial,e apostar na educação dos filhos, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Rita was born in Vilanculos, which is in Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is widowed and has two children who both go to school. Rita finished sixth grade and quit school because she didn't have the money for it. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her sister-in-law who lives with her.

She left her hometown looking for better living conditions. For more than two years Rita has been a businesswoman selling a variety of products, and she earns about 4,500 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Rita's first Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy products (peanuts, rice, juice, oil and other items) to increase her inventory.

She intends to build a mini-market in order to expand her business, and she plans to invest in her children's education, so she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (peanuts, rice, juice, oil, etc.).

loans.name: Joyceline

texts.en:
Joyceline is 52 and is a farmer in Murang'a, Central Kenya. She has been farming for 30 years. Her farm produces coffee and bananas which she sells to the local market. She is married with children, all adults save for the last born, who is still in school. 

Joyceline has requested a loan of 42,400 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will provide her with milk for the family's consumption and provide income to cater for other household needs. 

She adds that her economic status will be improved with frequent cash flows from the milk. 

Joyceline is however worried about the escalating costs of animal feed.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house (sand, iron, cement, stone, blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Nasceu  em Boane,  provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada  e  não tem filhos. Fez 2ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe e seu irmão enviando dinheiro para ajudar as despesas. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante  ha mais de 15 anos e dedica-se a compra e venda de produtos diversos, e tem um rendimento de serca de cerca de 12.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material PARA CONSTRUCAO DE UMA CASA ( areia, ferro, cimento,pedra, blocos, e outros) para a  sua obra. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 5.000.00mt,também  para a sua obra.
Pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in Boane, which is in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has no children. Isabel finished second grade and quit school because she could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother and brother by sending them money to help with their expenses.

She has never left her hometown. For more than 15 years Isabel has been a businesswoman, buying and selling various products. She earns around 12,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Isabel's second Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy construction materials for her house (sand, iron, cement, stone, blocks and other items). The first loan was for 5,000 meticais and was also used for home construction.

Isabel plans to finish her house and make her family more comfortable, so she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a house (sand, iron, cement, stone, blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a tiller drill and a bench grinder.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam, 31, is a married woman and has three children that live under her as dependents. Presently, she is in the business of pig fattening in the Baray District, Kompong Thom Province of Cambodia. From this business, she earns around $3 per day, which is apart from the additional revenue taken from her husband. Currently, her husband is a motor taxi driver who can earn an average of US$ 4 profit per day. According to her husband, his motorbike is broken and the lack of money is why she wants to request a loan in order to purchase a new motorbike for servicing clients in time. This loan will provide her with additional income to meet her family’s needs and provide more financial stability. She is very grateful to all lenders that are good and kind.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Ameena's Group

texts.en:
Ameena is a very active lady who supports her family financially by selling clothes. She purchases these clothes from the wholesale market and sells them to her neighborhood clients for a profit.  
Her husband is a master locksmith. He is an expert in unlocking jammed locks and also making duplicate keys.  
Ameena has 6 children. The eldest one operates a lathe machine while the other 2 are also master locksmiths, learning the trade from their father. 
Ameena has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her youngest son who wants to buy tools for his locksmith business.  
He is confident that he has now gained enough knowledge from his father to be able to handle his business independently. Ameena is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for him. 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Ameena.

loans.use: To buy tools for a locksmith business.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали житель Яванского района. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается растениеводством. Нурали в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 28 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en: Nurali is a resident of the district of Yavan. He is 38 years old, married, and has seven children. His wife is a homemaker. He is a farmer. Nurali mainly grows vegetables for sale. He has been doing this work for 28 years. He is taking out a loan to buy seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Denes

texts.en:
Denes is 38 years old and is married. He is the father of 4 school-aged children. The family lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. It was just a year ago that Denes started growing and propagating decorative goldfish and other fish at his home for sale. The fish are grouped according to size and similarity. Many people come and visit his place to see and buy earning him a total of PHP 8,000 a month. 
To avail himself of financial services and momentarily ease his financial difficulties, Denes joined GDMPC earlier this year. He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from the cooperative to purchase an aquarium for selling cultured fish. He will buy more fish variants when he gets enough funds and aquariums to display them properly and attract more buyers.

loans.use: To purchase an aquarium to sell cultured goldfish and other decorative fish.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and the father of an only child. He owns a motorcycle which he uses to make a living by transporting passengers to various destinations. The two-wheeled motorcycle is capable of carrying 2-4 passengers. His wife is also working for the family but it is not permanent work. A total of PHP 20,000 is earned at the end of the month.
The motorcycle has defects at the moment and it cannot function very well resulting in a drop in income over the past few days. To address this problem, Richard joined GDMPC to access financial services. He is initially requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 from the cooperative to buy motor tires and other spare parts to improve the quality of his service and earn more income. Richard can then continue driving. He expects to obtain sufficient income for the family and is planning to buy a motor cab to accommodate more passengers.

loans.use: To buy motor tires and other spare parts.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben, 29, is single and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past two years, Ruben has run a charcoal business. He is often busy and spends a lot of time manufacturing charcoals to be distributed to different locations, mainly in the market place. In a month, he gets PHP 5,000 from his business.
In 2008, Ruben became an official GDMPC member. This answers his need for financial services. In his first loan application he has requested PHP 5,000 from the organization to procure charcoal making materials and continue operating. It's hard and dirty work for some but it provides a good income for Ruben. He hopes that market demand for this product will increase so that he can earn more. He plans to invest some of his future earnings in poultry.

loans.use: To procure charcoal making materials.

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru:
Гулистон замужем и любящая мать 2 детей. Она добросовестная и целеустремленная женщина. Она занимается купля продажей продукты питания, а также хозяйственные товары, такие как порошок, шампунь, мыло и т.д. В этом бизнесе помогает ей её муж и сын. Гулистон хочет, чтобы её дети выросли в хороших условиях семьи и стали образованными и культурными людьми. Гулистон хотела бы получит кредит в размере 2300$ США для покупки муки и сахар оптом, который позволяет ей расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыли. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Guliston is a married and loving mother of two children.  She is a conscientious and goal-oriented woman.  She is involved in buying and selling food products and also household products, such as detergent powder, shampoo, soap, etc.  Her husband and son help with this business.  Guliston wants her children to grow up in good family conditions and become educated and well-mannered people.  Guliston wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2300 for the wholesale purchase of flour and sugar, which will allow her to expand her business and receive desired profits.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar wholesale

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a married woman whose husband works in a travel agency. He offers his customers services related to Hajj and Umra, which are Muslim religious festivals. 

Shazia has a job as a teacher in a nearby school. She is very talented in her profession and puts all of her effort into transferring her knowledge to her students. 

She also operates a business of selling clothes to make extra income. She sells clothes to her neighboring clients. Due to her good collection of clothes she receives a good number of orders every month. 

She is the mother of five children, all of whom are getting their education by attending school nearby. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk, which will allow her to offer more variety to her customers and increase her profits. 

She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that this investment will be a profitable one for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shazia.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. Analyn is single and has a jewelry business in the Philippines.

Analyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like necklaces to sell to customers.

Analyn has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like necklaces to sell to customers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. Cresencia is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cresencia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her store like eggs, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.

Cresencia has been in this business for 30 years.

Cresencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her store like eggs, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Genara is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Genara has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Genara requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more food stocks to sell in her food stall.

Genara has been in this business for 3 years. Genara would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more food stock to sell in her food stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 37 years old and has 3 children. Catalina is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Catalina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Catalina requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Catalina has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Catalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maristela

texts.en:
Maristela is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maristela is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Maristela has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Maristela requested a PHP 49,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy new beauty supplies for her beauty salon.

Maristela has been in this business for 25 years. Maristela would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new beauty supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Veronica has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads & biscuits. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock to sell.
Veronica has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Rodelyn has a retail shop that sells snacks, detergents, breads & biscuits. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Rodelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rodelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen has six children: three sons and three daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. Her eldest son helps his father in his shoe-making business. He does this work after coming back from school. 

Her husband is a cobbler and makes shoes. He gets orders from different shoe-selling shops and shoe factories and fulfills their orders to earn profits. Shoe-making is Parveen's family business; her husband is an expert at it and has operated it for the past 15 years. 

Parveen also supports him financially by making parandas (ornaments used to tie back hair), a very famous product for women. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who has a large order to fulfill. With the loan, he will buy leather, shoelaces, and nails in bulk to be able to complete his order on time and earn maximum profits.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for shoe-making business

loans.name: Nigela

texts.en:
Nigela is 33 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the Philippines. Nigela has a retail shop that sells clothes such as t-shirts, blouses, underwear, sandals, and other shoes. She has had this business for seven years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy clothes and sandals to sell.

Nigela is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nigela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals to sell

loans.name: John John

texts.en:
John John is 35 years old and married.  He lives in the Philippines. John John has a shop that sells coconut charcoal sacks. He has had this business for five years. He is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy coconut shells for making coco charcoal.

John John is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, John John hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts shells for making coco charcoal.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita  is 58 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Carmencita  has a pigpen and sells mature pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy animals feeds for pigs.

Carmencita  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Carmencita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animals feeds for pigs.

loans.name: Stellamaris

texts.en:
Stellamaris has been operating her tailoring business for the last year in Emali town. She is 49 years old and married. She and her husband John are blessed with two children.

Stellamaris was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add stock of cloth materials for tailoring.

In the future, Stellamaris hopes to venture into practicing large-scale farming.

loans.use: To add stock of cloth materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Rouiesa

texts.en:
Rouiesa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Rouiesa has a retail shop that sells items such as detergents, breads, biscuits, and canned goods. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and breads to stock her store.

Rouiesa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rouiesa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and breads to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of hair relaxer and hair pieces.

loans.name: Vecitascion

texts.en: Vecitascion, a 55-year-old married mother of one, lives in the Philippines where she has a food shop that sells viands such as afritada and caldereta. In business for 10 years, Vecitascion has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make more viands to sell. A new member of HSPFI, she hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands to sell.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez sews clothes part-time to support her family financially. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders every month. She is also a very responsible person by nature and carries out her responsibilities as a mother and a wife very well. 

Her husband is a retired railway employee and receives a pension every month. 

She has two sons and two daughters. Three of them are studying in a local school and getting their education. Her elder son operates a mobile phone shop. He left his education after completing matriculation and started this business. Through his shop he sells used and new mobile phones and  accessories. Her elder daughter does embroidery along with her studies to pay her education fees. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her son wants to buy mobile phones and accessories to expand his business. This will help him improve his sales and increase his profits. 

He has been operating his business for the past two years and he has obtained a good reputation in this short time period among his customers. Kaneez hopes that after the loan investment his business will be improved further.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones & accessories for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is aged 28 and married with four children ages between 7 and 1. She has been in dairy farming for 9 years within her home area of Litein, South Rift Kenya with her milk produce sold to Brookside Dairies.

Beatrice has requested for a first loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her plant both nappier grass and silage for her dairy cows. She says buying animal feed has become costly and it much better for a farmer to grow rather than buy the feed. This she reiterates will save her much and make repayment easier.

Beatrice reiterates the high cost of feed is the main challenge.

loans.use: To pay for planting of nappier grass and sillage.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda, a 55-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has a retail shop that sells vegetables such as squash and eggplant. In  business for 20 years, she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more vegetables to sell.  Rosalinda, a new member of HSPFI, hopes to improve her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farming implements such as manure, mulch, good seeds, and farm tools.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Imelda has a retail shop that sells fruits (like avocados) and vegetables (like squash). She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

Imelda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Imeld hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rose Fe

texts.en:
Rose Fe is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Rose Fe has a retail shop that sells green bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Rose Fe is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rose Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Desida

texts.en:
Desida is 38 years old and married with 3 children.

Desida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying & selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Desida has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business of buying & selling for 3 years and also earns an income from candy making.

Desida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beans, maize, millet and g-nuts for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and married with 6 children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries and other items to sell.

Gloria has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for a year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Gloria aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of groceries and other items to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer  is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Jennifer has a retail shop business in which she buys & sells recycled materials, like bottles. She has had this business for 12 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy recycled, like bottles, for resale.

Jennifer is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials, like bottles, to resell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying & selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell for her business of buying & selling fish.

Jennifer has been in this business for 5 years. Jennifer earns additional  income from a sari sari store.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy assorted fish to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Merlyn has a retail shop from which she sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Merlyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Jacqueline has a bake shop where she sells breads & pastries. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed for baking breads.

Jacqueline is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for baking breads.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is age 63 and married with 9 children. The youngest is still in school. He lives with his family in the Litein area, South Rift, Kenya. He has been in farming for 30 years and currently sells his milk products to the local Kokiche chilling plant, while tea and coffee go to the local market. He has one farmhand.

Philip has requested for a loan 57,700 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will help raise his family's living standard. He is optimistic the farming business will grow.

Philip sees poor market prices for farm produce and droughts as the challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase  and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and married with 4 children. With 2 children in school, Rosa works very hard to provide for them.

Rosa runs a buying & selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and hasrequested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosa has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Rosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buying & selling of fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Rosemarie has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Araceli has a retail shop business, selling canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Araceli is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old and married with 6 children. With 1 child in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a buying and selling of scrap business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional scrap to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Elizabeth would like to save enough to repair and renovate the family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Geraldine has a retail shop business, selling canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits & snacks.

Geraldine is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits & snacks.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru:
Робия трудолюбивая, честная и добросовестная женщина. Она всегда старается сделать всем добро. Она  вдова и любящая мать 1 сына. Она мечтает, устроит своего сына в хорошую школу и она хочет, чтобы её сын стал образованным человеком.  Для содержанию свою семью она начала заниматься приготовлением лепешек с 2002 года со своими родственниками. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить своё жилищное условие. Робия хотела бы получить займ в размере 2300$ США для покупки муку на запас с целью расширения бизнеса. Она заранее благодарна всем кредиторам за поддержку и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Robiya is a hard-working, honest and conscientious woman.  She always tries to show kindness to others.  She is a widow and a loving mother of one son.  She dreams of getting her son into a good school and wants her son to become an educated person.  Together with her relatives, she started baking flatbread in 2002 in order to support her family.  She wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions.  Robiya wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2300 for the purchase of flour to stock in order to expand her business.  She is grateful in advance to all of the creditors for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the Philippines. Gemma has a retail shop where she sells rice,  pancakes, snacks, and canned goods . She has had this business for 18 years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Gemma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en: Mr. Phoeurn is 24 years old and lives in Orn Long Veng District, Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is married and has three children. He and his wife work hard together and depend on the income from the farming business to support their family's needs. They work as farmers; rice is their primary crop. Due to the rainy season and the lack of money, Mr. Phoeurn would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He and his wife earn approximately 3 USD per day, but he is hopeful that, with a loan, he will be able to increase his income and be a better provider for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn (pictured here), 26, is a garment worker. She lives with her brother and widowed mother, who is a rice farmer in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. 

Chanthorn is asking for a loan of $200 to help with her mother’s farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To help with her mother’s farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Rochelle has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, & beverages. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. 

Rochelle is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rochelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Seila

texts.en:
Seila, 29, is single. She lives with her brother and sister and widowed mother in a village along National Road Number 5 approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Seila is a garment worker. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike to drive to work.

Note: the motorbike behind Seila does not belong to her, it belongs to Maxima’s credit officer. Seila is just standing there to have her picture taken.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Rosemarie has a retail shop that sells fruits like avocado. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy fruits to sell.
Rosemarie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun, 48, and his wife, Channy, 41, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and five daughters. Five are married and other two are garment workers.  Yun is a horse-cart driver and does construction work. He also assists his wife in farming. He is asking for a loan of $1,200 to build a restroom for family use and build a stairway of his house because it’s old and breaks.

loans.use: To build a restroom for family use and build a stairway of his house because it’s old and breaks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has been operating her carpentry and welding business for the last 12 years in Kasieku, Emali town. She is 32 years old married to Robert, and they have three children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan, which she intends to use to purchase timber and iron sheets for the business. In the future, Mary hopes to expand her business and open a hardware shop.

loans.use: To purchase timber and iron sheets  for the business.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en: Sarim is a rice farmer and her husband, Veng, is a construction worker. They have been married since 1987 and have four children -- one son and three daughters. One is married, one is a construction worker, and other two are garment workers. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. Sarim is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work and to buy fertilizer to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work and buy fertilizer to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Chanthou has full-time employment with an NGO in Phnom Penh. She is a widow with one son who has full-time employment, and one daughter attending school. The family lives in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Chanthou is asking for her second loan in the amount of $200 to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru:
Маърифат вдова и ответственная мать 2 детей. Она трудолюбивая, умная и добрая женщина. Когда её муж покинул их, она тяжело переносила те дни и думала, как зарабатывать денег чтобы кормит своих детей. Тогда она начала заниматься приготовлением лепешек со своими родственниками. Она мечтает, устроит своих детей в хорошую школу, и она хочет, видит их в будущем образованными и трудолюбивыми человеками.  Она занимается этим бизнесом более 5 лет. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и зарабатывать много денег для своих детей. Маърифат хотела бы получить займ в размере 2300$ США для покупки муку на запас с целью расширения бизнеса. Она заранее хочет, благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Marifat is a widow and a responsible mother of two children.  She is a hard-working, smart and kind woman.  When her husband passed away, she had a hard time surviving those days and thought about how to make money in order to feed her children.  It was then that she started to prepare flatbread together with her relatives.  She dreams of placing her children into a good school and wants and sees them becoming educated and hard-working people in the future.  She has been involved in this business for over five years.  She wants to expand her business and earn a lot of money for her children.  Marifat wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2300 for the purchase of flour to stock in order to expand her business.  She wants to thank all of the creditors in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Sokhim (in the photo) is a garment worker, while her husband, Song, is a construction worker. They have three daughters: two are in school and another one is still young. The family is living in a suburb, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sokhim asked for a loan from Kiva to renovate the house where she lives because the house was small and difficult for family members to stay. Sokhim is in the processing of renovating, so she is asking for another loan of $1,200 to make the finishes.

loans.use: to finish her house building.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas has been operating a boutique for the last year in Oloitoktok town.  She is 31 years old and married to John. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add stock of trousers and shirts.

In future, Felicitas hopes to expand her business and open a boutique in Oloitoktok town.

loans.use: to add stock of trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Mr. Seak, 26 years old, lives in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is married to Ngen and has no children. Currently, he has a business selling soybean near one market and around his community. With his smile and very good friendliness, he sells well every day. He can earn around $3 per day. He is a hardworking husband, supporting his family's daily needs. To improve his family's living conditions, Mr. Seak would like to request some funds from Kiva's partner HKL in order to purchase more soybean. He says that this loan will increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase more soybean.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda  has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Erlinda  has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Noleen

texts.en:
Noleen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional linens and other materials for her tailoring business.

Noleen has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from fishing/fish vending.

Noleen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional linens and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit for dairy cows

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is the mother of two sons and a daughter.  Two of them are studying and the youngest one is less than three years old and hasn’t started an education yet. Her husband operates a business selling clothes and she supports him financially by doing embroidery and sewing work for her neighborhood customers. It is very difficult to manage the household expenses due to the increased cost of living everyday. That’s why both of them work very hard to survive financially.
 
Nargis has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business selling clothes. With the loan, he will purchase clothes in bulk, which will enable him to offer more variety to his clients and minimize his cost of traveling every month. Nargis is hopeful that an investment will help him establish his business and increase his income.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nargis.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for her fishing/fish vending business.

Lorlyn has been in this business for 25 years. Lorlyn earns more income from buying and selling fermented shrimp.

Lorlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  lives in  Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her brother’s children).   

Sarah has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale.  

Sarah has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenge(s) for Sarah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van.

Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling household equipment in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Mary has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Mary has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
For the last 24 years, Tabitha has been practicing farming in Magina, Limuru town. She is a 79 year old widow.

Tabitha was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings for planting and to pay for tilling the land.

In the future, Tabitha hopes to practice large scale farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings for planting and to pay for tilling the land.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mrs. Thou has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has six children. Three of her children have already married and live separately and two other children are working as sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh where they can earn a low salary per month. The last one is enrolled in school. 

As for her husband, he works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good weather for her crop. However, Thou doesn’t have enough capital yet to use on her farm. So Thou is seeking a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Thou is very grateful to all lenders that support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Veronica works hard to support her family.

She has an ambulant vending business selling bread in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Veronica is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more bread to sell for her ambulant vending bread business.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Imelda has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from food vending and networking.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Altankhuyag

texts.en: Mr. Altankhuyag is 31 years old and has applied for a loan to raise his current business assets. He manages a clothing retail kiosk in a store called “Sunday” and has been running this business since 2008. Currently he is unmarried and lives in a ger: a nomadic tent of Mongolia. He sells many typical clothing including sports, seasonal and casual clothes. Now, he is planning to purchase a large number of brand-named clothes from abroad. But, he has a financial problem in carrying out this plan. A loan he is taking will be used to supplement the purchase of his inventory.

loans.use: to aggregate the money of his sale commodities supply.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 28 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a small-scale wood sales business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional wood to sell.

Mylene has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the wood business for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mylene aspires to save money to expand her business and send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy additional wood to sell.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Малика замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Она порядочная, умная и добрая женщина. Она занимается приготовлением лепешек со своими родственниками более 10 лет и у неё очень богатый опыт. Она хочет, устроит своих детей в хорошую школу, и выросли хорошими образованными и трудолюбивыми людьми. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получит хорошую прибыль. Малика хотела бы получить займ в размере 2300$ США для покупки муку на запас с целью расширения бизнеса. Она благодарна вам Кива кредиторы за вашу поддержку и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Malika is a married and loving mother of three children.  She is a decent, smart and kind woman.  She has been involved in preparing flatbread together with her relatives for over ten years and has a very rich experience in this field.  She wants to place her children into a good school, so that they grow up to be good, educated and hard-working people.  She wants to expand her business and receive a good profit.  Malika wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2300 for the purchase of flour to stock with the goal of expanding her business.  She is grateful to Kiva creditors for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Jene

texts.en:
Jene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a wood sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional wood to sell.

Jene has been in this business for four years. Jene earns more income from her general store.

Jene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood to sell.

loans.name: Saira Bano

texts.en:
Saira bano has given birth to four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son has matriculated and now sews and makes embroidery on clothes. The next two children are illiterate and her two youngest children are studying. 

Her husband is an employee in an organization and she supports him financially by sewing clothes and by doing embroidery work. She is very skillful and prepares beautiful looking dresses for her clients. She is also involved in a thread making business. She gets the thread from old warm clothes and then sells to thread sellers at a profit. Along with her businesses, she also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her thread selling business. With the loan, she will buy old warm clothes to get thread out of them for selling. She has been doing this business for the past 15 years and she is confident that an investment will be a profitable one for her.

loans.use: To buy old warm clothes

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Azucena works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Azucena is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Azucena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Margie's Group

texts.en:
Margie’ s group is comprised of three hard working women. Margie is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zana, in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children. One of her children is currently in school. Margie has a business of a small retail shop that sells soap and sugar, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Margie has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap and sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margie hopes to generate greater profits and to buy new clothes for herself. In the future, Margie hopes to build rental houses. Margie is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap, sugar for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima lives in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (an orphan). 

Halima has a business of a cosmetics shop. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Halima sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. 

Halima has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings, from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenge(s) for Halima include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop and also to educate her children up to university level. Halima lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Candelaria works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Candelaria is borrowing 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase a fishing net for her fishing/fish vending business.

Candelaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Agripinah

texts.en:
Agripinah is a married woman who has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, Agripinah has owned real estate houses. Her potential customers are tenants from the neighboring village. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by tenants. Agripinah dreams of establishing another real estate house in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase building materials, sand and cement. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, sand and cement.

loans.name: Akiba

texts.en:
Akiba is a married man who has two children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has piped water, but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, Akiba has operated a stationery selling business, selling items from a shop, to his neighbours. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season the demand is lower compared to supply. He dreams of establishing a photocopying business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase text books and pens for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase text books and pens for resale.

loans.name: Saleri

texts.en:
Saleri is a forty year old married man who has four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

The responsibility to look after the family rests on Saleri. He has been operating a retail shop for six years. He got his start up capital from farming. His hardships are price fluctuations and theft during the transportation of goods. His vision for the future is to have a wholesale shop plus, to educate his children.

Saleri needs the loan facility to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to resell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a brother).

Sarah has a business of selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Sarah has requested for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes.  

The main business challenge(s) for Sarah include thieves during transportation of her goods and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell on wholesale only and also to build rental rooms.

Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Amkeni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Matiko, leader du groupe d’affaire « Amkeni », est entrepreneur, âgée de 57 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous et  autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse des pommes de terre. Son mari est un Militaire, ancien combattant passionné (mise en retraite). Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central de Virunga. En outre, elle vend aussi des unités cellulaires d’appel  à son domicile. Il y a 15 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle a eu son premier capital de la tontine initiée par les femmes de militaires dans le camp ; Plus tard, elle a reçu une petite commission issue d’une vente de parcelle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  5 sacs de pomme de terre à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  construire une maison à ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique et surtout, dit-elle, nul n’ignore les conditions macabres de vie militaire et leurs familles.
texts.en:
Matiko is an entrepreneur, and the leader of the Amkeni business group. She is 57 years old, married, and she has seven children still in school whereas others are already independent. Her husband is a retired veteran of the military. She sells potatoes at the central market of Virunga. As a secondary activity, she also sells cell phone units from her home. 

She has been making a living from these activities for over 15 years. She obtained her first capital through the local tontine (a revolving savings fund) initiated by military wives of the area. She later received a small commission on the sale of a plot of land. 

This new loan will allow her to buy five sacks of potatoes for resale. Her goal is to provide for her children’s tuition and have a house built for them. 

She wishes to thank Hekima for helping poor women who are excluded from traditional banks. More importantly, she says that no one should ignore the gruesome conditions of military life and its impact on the families.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of potatoes for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, detergents and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Alaisha

texts.en:
From Uganda, Alaisha is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her sister and brother. She lives in a home that she owns, which has electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

Alaisha has had a food stall at the market for the past four years and works seven days a week. She also earns money by renting houses. Transportation, thieves and seasonality are Alaisha’s main challenges.

Alaisha has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas and sweet and Irish potatoes. Her goals and aspirations are to sell by wholesale only and to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas and sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
From Uganda, Justine is single and has two children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. Justine lives in a home that she owns; however, she has no electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family. Transportation and seasonality are Justine’s main business challenges.

Justine has a shop where she sells daily-use products. She has had her shop for ten years and works seven days a week. She also generates additional income through farming and selling fried chapatti.

Justine has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of soap, bags of sugar and cartons of salt.

Justine’s goals and aspirations include owning a fully-stocked shop and educating her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru: Таварали проживает в районе Яван. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него 8 детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Уже восемь лет как он занимается животноводством. Он в основном занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Целью получения кредита является закуп скота в дальнейшем для продажи.
texts.en: Tavarali live in Yavan. He is 43 years old, married, and has eight children. He has a high school education. He has been a herdsman for eight years.  He mainly works buying and selling livestock.  He is taking out a loan to buy livestock for resale.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Sophia's Group

texts.en:
Sophia is seventeen years old and lives in the town of Zana in the west Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year Sophia has sold charcoal.

Sophia‘s Group is comprised of Sophia and another hardworking woman. Sophia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

To help her charcoal business, Sophia has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda, which will be used to purchase more charcoal to sell. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Sophia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.

In the future, Sophia hopes to grow her charcoal business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is a 35-year-old hardworking man with one child. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating an internet cafe for four years. He started with four computers and now has six of them. He also runs a video library. His vision is to have 10 computers to host as many clients as possible. Edgar needs the loan to buy computers for his internet cafe.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther’s Group is comprised of three hardworking women. Esther herself is twenty years old and lives in the town of Zana in the west Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year Esther has run a beauty salon.

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. It will be used to purchase hair braids to sell.

Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her job skills, such as teaching her hairdressing.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for herself. In the future, Esther hopes to grow her salon business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids to sell.

loans.name: Oung

texts.en: Mrs. Oung is 42 years old, married, and has five children who are living under her revenue. Currently she is in the business of pig fattening in the Baray District, Kompong Thom province of Cambodia. From this business, she can earn about $2 per day. Additional income is taken from her husband. Currently her husband sells firewood in front of his house. He would like to transport firewood to clients’ houses but a lack of money is why Oung and her husband would like to request funds from Kiva partner HKL. The purpose of the loan would be to purchase a tractor for developing his business over time and to satisfy his clients. Oung says that these funds are very important for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther’s group is comprised of four hard working women. Esther is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Esther has a tailoring business, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials for making clothes to sell.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. In the future, Esther hopes to expand her business.  Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 43 and married with three children between four and seventeen years old. She has been in farming for seven years and currently employs two farmhands in a farm which produces milk, tomatoes, maize, and beans. She runs a retail shop in the local market for additional income.

Catherine has requested for a loan of 45,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the loan will help her uplift her family's living standards by buying pure breed dairy cows which will generate more income.

She reckons with the lack of animal feeds during dry seasons but remains greatful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan facility.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en:
Mkambe is a married woman with eight children. Seven of her children graduated from school and one still attends school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a firewood, charcoal and food vending business. Her potential customers are the neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation because of poor roads. Mkambe dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is 38 years old and married with seven children. All of them are studying except the second one who works as a tailor and specializes in sewing gents clothes. Her husband is a driver by profession and she supports him by selling clothes to her community clients. Due to her good variety of clothes, she receives a good number of orders every month and makes good sales. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk quantity. That will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers and will also minimize the cost of traveling. She has been operating her business for the past 10 years and she hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to her business and increase her income. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application with Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shaheen.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ganselem

texts.en:
Mr. Ganselem requested a loan to increase his business output. He is 40 years old, a shoe seller, and lives with his daughter and wife in Ulaanbaatar-the capital city of Mongolia.
