Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y colorantes, como así también bastidores  para tejer hamacas ya que en esta temporada son muy solicitadas por sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Mr. Aureliano is 56 years old. He has been married for 29 years to Lucila who is 48 years old. They have four children together who are grown up already.
Mr. Aureliano is the son of a farmer. He grew up in one of the Carapeguá regions, and he worked in the country with his father. When he was 26 years old, he married his wife who is the daughter of a weaver, and they began to work together. They have been selling the traditional bedspreads and hammocks for more than 20 years. They take them to zones of Itapúa and Ciudad del Este to be sold. He relies on customers who are well established. Along with his wife who is a craftswoman, he makes blankets and in this way it is cheaper. Thanks to this work and both of their efforts, they were able to build a lovely house and also buy a truck, which he uses to distribute their products. At the same time, he can provide his family with an honorable and dignified life.
He is asking for the loan to buy threads and dyes, as well as frames to weave hammocks which are requested frequently by their customers during this season. He thanks the Foundation for the opportunity that this provides him, since obtaining this loan will be much help to him.

loans.use: to buy threads, dyes, and frames to weave hammocks.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Florence. She is married and has four children aged 27, 24, 18 and 15. Two of them are in school. She has one dependent, who lives with her because he is in school. 

In 1991, Florence established her foodstuff business, selling bulgar, garri (dried cassava tuber) and corn flour. She began her business in order to augment her husband's effort and to enhance her independence. Working seven days a week, and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Florence requires a loan in order to buy more bulgar, garri, and corn flour. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. In the future, Florence plans to complete the construction of her house, and to improve on the level of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bulgar, garri (dried cassava), and corn flour

loans.name: Daisy Patricia

texts.es:
La señorita Daisy tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres. Su padre se dedica al trasporte público, tiene buen ingreso económico, y es el quien siempre la apoya en todos sus emprendimientos y sueños.
Ella está cursando el segundo ciclo del Curso Probatorio de Admisión en la carrera de Contaduría Publica en la Universidad Nacional de Asunción. Ella se define como una joven llena de sueños, anhelos y esperanzas, tiene como propósito culminar sus estudios dentro de cuatro años aproximadamente, recibir su título y ejercer su profesión de manera a poder ayudar a sus padres retribuyéndoles todo lo que ellos dieron por ella en pos de su educación.
Ella solicita el crédito para el pagos de los gastos de la universidad, y la compra de materiales de estudios. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da para poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Daisy is 19 years old, is single, and lives with her parents. Her father works in public transportation, has a good income, and always supports her in her endeavors and dreams. She is in the second semester of Probationay Admission Course for the career of Public Accounting at the National University of Asuncion. She sees herself as a young person with many dreams, wishes, and hopes. She intends to complete her studies in about four years, receive her diploma and work in her profession in a way that allows her to help her parents, repaying all that they've done for her towards her education. She asks for a loan to pay the university fees and to buy study materials. She thanks the Fundacion for the opportunity which allows her to move forward in her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses and to buy study materials.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is a married woman with three children, two attend school while one graduated from high school. She owns a house that neither has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past six years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of purchasing chicken feed. Damaris dreams of expanding her business and purchasing a van in the future. With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase 20 chicks and chick mash. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 20 chicks and chick mash.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and farm manure

loans.name: Mutindi

texts.en: Mutindi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past ten years, Mutindi has operated a fruit-selling business, selling from the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. Mutindi dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer’s needs. With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase 50 bags of passion fruits and oranges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of passion fruit and oranges.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en: Bibi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past year, Bibi has operated a business making tea for sale, selling at the school site to school teachers and school children. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase two goats, tea leaves, and sugar for making tea for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two goats, tea leaves, and sugar for making tea for sale.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en: Kuruthum, who is in her mid-20s is single with two children: one of them in school.  She has been selling sodas, juice and water for the past year.  She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a very small monthly profit. This will be Kuruthum's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use to buy more sodas, juice and water. Her dream is to one day be able to send her children to good schools. She will share this loan with her loan group "Juhudi" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more soda, juice and water to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer, wheat flour and cooking fat for her farming and hotel businesses.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is an enterprising 48-year-old businessman who is married to Tabitha (who is also in business). They are blessed with two children, aged 23 and 21. John has been running a hotel for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD  after successfully repaying his previous loans. John will use this loan to buy cooking fat, wheat flour and a television set. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, wheat flour and a television set.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a single woman with four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a dry fish selling business at the market for her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to boost her business to meet her customer’s needs. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase two goats, bundles of fish and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two goats, bundles of fish and cooking fat.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Sara quién invito y organizó a sus amigas y vecinas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Ellas aceptaron gustosas y de allí surgió el grupo. Actualmente está integrado por 20 mujeres
La señora. Sara está acompañada hace 13 años con el señor Julio quien trabaja en oficios varios como ser plomero, albañilería, electricista, tienen dos hijas menores de edad que van a la escuela. La señora Sara se dedica a la venta de comestibles, comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran de ella. Se considera una mujer con muy buenas manos para la cocina. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un comedor donde deleite a muchas personas con sus platos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los alimentos, como ser carnes, condimentos, panificados. Está muy contenta por la oportunidad que le da la Fundación, y lo agradece.
texts.en:
This communal bank was launched by Mrs Sara who invited and organised her friends and neighbours to form a part of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. They glady accepted the invitation and the group was formed. Currently there are 20 women in the group. Mrs Sara has been in a relationship with Mr Julio for the last 13 years. He works in various trades such as plumbing, masonry and electrical work. They have 2 daughters, both minors, who attend school. Mrs Sara sells groceries. She says that she has many customers who always buy from her. She considers herself to be a very good cook. One of her dreams is to have a diner where many would be able to enjoy her cooking. 

She is asking for a loan to buy consumables for cooking such as meat, seasonings, baked goods. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity afforded her by the Fundación.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings and baked goods.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 59-year-old mixed-crop farmer. She is widowed with three adult children, aged 35, 30 and 25. She has been a farmer for the past 20 years with a monthly income of KES 16,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan successfully. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will buy another plot of land for farming. 

Her hope is to buy watering pipes to water her crops to increase the yield from the farm to support herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 23 years old and single. He has been running a salon for the past six months with a monthly income of KES 5,000 which he uses to pay for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Victor will use the loan to buy a blow dryer, shaving machine and shampoo. 

With the anticipated profit he will expand his business and hire some workers. His hopes and dreams are to have a family and open salon branches in different sites.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer, shaving machine and shampoo.

loans.name: Mwanakama

texts.en:
Mwanakame is a widowed woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetables stall business, buying tomatoes and potatoes for resale. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation from the market to her place of sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is 25 years old; he is married to Esther who is employed. They are blessed with one child aged two years old. Benedict has been running a barber shop, a salon, and a cyber café in one room for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.


He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Benedict will use the loan to buy computers for his cyber café and a blow dyer.  With the anticipated profit from the three businesses, he will educate his brother, since the two of them are orphans, and his child.

His hopes and dreams are to have his brother continue with education up to university level and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy computers for his cyber café and a blow dryer.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five children, one of whom still attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a cloth ("Kikoi" used for clothing) sales business; she sells along the beach shores to tourists at the beach. Mwanajuma also does weaving of mats for sale as her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality due to low and high seasons in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of cloth for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth for resale.

loans.name: Mburu

texts.en:
Mburu is 64 years old; he is married to Regina who is a farmer. They are blessed with two adult children aged 30 and 27 years old. He has been a mixed crop farmer for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mburu will use the loan to buy livestock for selling which will boost his farming business. 

He will use the anticipated profit as working capital in the farm. His hopes are to venture into dairy farming and continue with livestock selling.

loans.use: To buy livestock for selling which will boost his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Irma Petronila

texts.es:
Irma, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos D. 16, 12, 11 y 8 años D. edad, ella es ama D. casa y su esposo es agricultor, actualmente se encuentra sembrando maíz en una manzana D. terreno, se apoyan mucho en las actividades, ella en este caso solicita un préstamo para cubrir el gasto en abono, para que su esposo lo aplique en la milpa.
Este préstamo le ayudara para fortalecer la planta y que tenga un buen desarrollo, con la intención D. obtener una buena producción, su propósito es que a través del trabajo que realiza en conjunto con su esposo, puedan mejorar las instalaciones D. la vivienda, ofreciendo una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma lives with her husband and four children (ages 16, 12, 11, and 8). She is a homemaker and her husband is a farmer. Her husband is currently growing corn on approximately 1.7 acres of land, which he relies upon for his business activities. Irma is taking this opportunity to request a loan to cover the cost of compost that her husband will apply to his cornfield.

This loan will help strengthen and develop his crop with the intended purpose of obtaining good production. Irma seeks to work together with her husband so that they can improve their living quarters and offer a better life to their children.

loans.use: to buy compost for growing corn.

loans.name: Benita Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Benita es soltera, tiene 43 años, tiene una hija de 11 años que está estudiando en la escuela.
Anteriormente ella era empleada en un supermercado, gracias a sus trabajos anteriores y con los ahorros que pudo juntar abrió para su propia despensa en el mercado, después cambio de ramo dedicándose a la compra y venta de ropas usadas y nuevas, en lo cual se desempeña actualmente. Cuenta con varios clientes que de forma habitual compran de ella las prendas que vende.
Le gustaría seguir creciendo en el área comercial ya que ella se considera una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ansias de salir adelante. Le gustaría que su hija culmine sus estudios ya que ella no pudo estudiar por ser madre soltera y que pueda ampliar más su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de estación de invierno, con lo cual podrá abastecer su stock de mercaderías. Está contenta por la oportunidad que la Fundación le da.
texts.en:
Benita is single, 43 years old, and has an 11 year old daughter who's studying in school.

Previously she was an employee at a supermarket. Thanks to her previous jobs and the savings she saved up, she opened her own store in the market. Afterwards she changed areas, making a living buying and selling new and used clothing, which she currently does. She relies on several customers that regularly buy the clothing she sells.

She would like to continue growing in the commercial area as she considers herself a very entrepreneurial woman with a yearning to get ahead. She would like her daughter to complete her studies as she couldn't study since she was a single mother and would like her business to be able to expand.

She is requesting the loan to purchase winter clothing with which to supply her merchandise stock. She is happy for the opportunity that the Fundación has given her.

loans.use: to buy clothing for future sales.

loans.name: Mercedes Concepcion

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes es una joven trabajadora, soltera; que se dedica a la venta de ropa al por menor y a la venta de comida y desayunos, la señorita mercedes comenzó hace un año a vender desayunos a los trabajadores de los fundos agrícolas y también hace 2 años comenzó a vender ropa a sus vecinos y amigos de fundos.  Mercedes eligió este trabajo porque son rentables y se gana bien. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería (ropa) y también en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus desayunos y comidas. Sus principales sueños de Mercedes es tener su casa propia y tener un puesto propio para poder  vender la ropa.
texts.en: Mercedes is a young, single and hardworking woman that sells clothes by the piece and also sells food such as breakfasts.  She began one year ago selling breakfast foods to field workers and two years back began selling clothes to neighbors and friends.  Mercedes chose this line of work because it is both profitable and viable. This credit will be used to buy merchandise (clothing) as well as ingredients for breakfast foods.  Her dreams are to one day have her own house and to establish a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Dena

texts.en:
Dena is a married man with eight children; seven attend school while one has completed school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over eighteen years, he has operated a restaurant business; his potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. He faces a major challenge of perishable products in his restaurant causing losses. Dena dreams of expanding the business to a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase food items, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase food items: bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a divorced woman with seven children, four attend school while three have completed school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, knitting babies' hats and pullovers. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of ready market. Dena dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a weaving machine, materials and needles. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a weaving machine, materials and needles.

loans.name: Celso Enoc

texts.es:
Celso, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica al taller de estructuras metálicas, cielos falsos y trabajos de tabla roca, dicho taller lo tiene instalado en su vivienda, pero viaja por los municipios cercanos a realizar las instalaciones.
Él invertirá un préstamo en la compra de materiales como cielos falsos, aluminio, masía, también en reparación de algunas herramientas, esto le ayudara para tener todos los materiales necesarios para brindar su trabajo, mejorando el servicio a los clientes y los ingresos que pueda tener su familia.
texts.en:
Celso lives with his wife and two children. He operates a metal shop, but he also performs ceiling and drywall work. Celso says that is business is located in his home, but he also travels to nearby towns to perform installations.

He will invest this loan in the purchase of materials such as ceiling tiles, aluminum, and farmhouse stones. Celso will also have some of his equipment repaired. This will help him have all the necessary materials for performing his job. As a result, he will be able to provide better service to his customers and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as ceiling tiles, aluminum, farmhouse stones, and to pay for equipment repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, rice, beans, and meat.

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
Gambo is a married man with five children; four attend school while one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, he has operated a garage business, servicing motor vehicles. He faces a major challenge of power shortages and machine failures. Gambo dreams of purchasing another machine and employing more people in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase welding rods, iron sheets and tubes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase welding rods, iron sheets and tubes.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo-Akpokpota Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO-AKPOKPOTA est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, Héleine(qui a la main levée sur la photo), est mariée à un certain Robert. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont encore à leur charge. L'un des enfants est scolarisé. Héleine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Héleine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Héleine prépare de la nourriture qu'elle vend de façon ambulante. Héleine exerce cette activité depuis deux ans, ce qui lui permet de faire face aux diverses charges de la maison. Héleine s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Héleine et les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO-AKPOKPOTA sollicitent l'appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur capacité financière et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The GBENONKPO-AKPOKPOTA group consists of four people who all live together in the same house. The group's representative, Héleine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is married to a man named Robert. The couple have two children who are still dependent on them. One of the children is in school. Héleine lives together with her children and her husband. Héleine has very little schooling.
To provide for herself and for her family, Héleine prepares food that she sells as a street vendor. Héleine has been working as a street vendor for two years, and this enables her to cope with the household expenses. Héleine buys her provisions in one of the markets in Benin.
This is the first time Héleine and the other members of the GBENONKPO-AKPOKPOTA group have requested financial support from ALIDé so that they can strengthen their financial capacity and better respond to their customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy rice and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phone cases, chargers, and protective gear.

loans.name: Msisiri Group

texts.en:
Maulidi, who is in his early 40s, is married with one child who goes to school. He has been selling fruit and vegetables for 10 years now.  He works from 3am to 11 am (works in the mornings only) daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania; he wants to use it to buy more sacks of vegetables. He collects his vegetable from the farmers who bring them from upcountry at wholesale prices and has to be at the marketplace at 3am in order to get good quality and a lot of sacks of vegetables.  He then sells at retail price.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group  "Msisiri" which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of vegetables.

loans.name: Mahutin Pk10 Group

texts.fr: MAHUTIN PK10 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Eudoxie(qui a la main levée sur la photo),est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à un carreleur du nom de Jules. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Eudoxie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Eudoxie a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Eudoxie mène comme activité, la vente des ustensiles de cuisine. Parallèlement à cette activité, Eudoxie vend de l'huile de palme et de l'huile d'arachide. Eudoxie s'approvisionne au Bénin et au Nigeria, État voisin du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Eudoxie et les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN PK10 sollicitent l'appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur capacité financière et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Mahutin PK10 is a group of three people, who live together in the same neighborhood and belong to the same "tontine" group ("tontine" is a revolving finance system whereby each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to the different members). The representative of the group, Eudoxie (who has her hand raised on the photo) is 25 years old and married to a tiler by the name of Jules.The couple has two children, both at school and in their care. Eudoxi lives with her husband and children. She went to school very little. In order to provide for her needs and those of her family she has a business selling kitchen utensils. At the same time she sells palm oil and groundnut oil. Eudoxie gets her supplies in Benin and its neighboring state, Nigeria. This is the second time that Eudoxie and the other members of the Mahutin PK10 group have requested financial aid from Alidé, with the aim of strengthening their financial capacity and better responding to customer demand. The first loan they had has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Eloina

texts.es:
La señora Eloina tiene 47 años D. edad, es viuda desD. hace un tiempo y tiene dos hijas, una D. ella ya es mayor D. edad con independencia económica y la otra en edad escolar que aun depenD. D. la madre. Ella vive junto con su familia en su propia casa situada en la cuidad D. Encarnación.
La señora es modista, se dedica a la costura desD. hace varios años, además posee en su casa un pequeño kiosko que es atendido por ella misma o por sus hijas. Gracias a estas actividades ella ha podido siempre salir adelante, para mantener su hogar y cubrir todos los gastos que se requiere ya que es conocida en el barrio y siempre cuenta con trabajo. Además cuenta con el apoyo económico D. su hija y su yerno que están viviendo en la casa.
Ella ha solicitado este crédito para completar el importe necesario para comprar un vehiculo, ya que desea traer  mercaderías para la utilización en su taller D. costura.
texts.en:
Eloina is 47 years old, she became a widow a few years ago and she has two daughters: one is an adult and economically independent, the other goes to school and depends economically on her mother. Eloina lives with her family in her own house in the town of Encarnación.
Eloina is a seamstress, an activity she has been engaged in for many years; on top of this, she owns a small stall in her house which is run by herself or her daughters. Thanks to these activities she has always been able to proviD. for and support her family, and to pay for all the necessary expenses as, being well known in her neighborhood, she always receive requests. She can also count on economic support from her daughter and her son-in-law, who are currently living in her house.
The loans she is requesting will be used to reach the needed amount to buy a vehicle she will use to carry the goods she employs in her sewing workshop.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle to transport goods to her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Esmeralda Elizeth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, venD. lácteos, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 8 y 7 años D. edad, el negocio D. los lácteos lo tiene ubicado en su casa, para realizar los productos compra la leche, y en esta ocasión quiere con un préstamo comprar suficiente leche por un periodo.
El préstamo le ayudara para tener los insumos necesarios en la casa y poder producir más quesos, cuajada, requesón, que todos son derivados D. la leche, con esto procura tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Esmeralda sells dairy products. She lives with her husband and two children, ages 8 and 7. Esmeralda operates her business out of her home. In order to make her products, she has to buy milk. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy enough milk to last for an extended period.

This loan will help her to be stocked with the necessary supplies at home for making cheeses, curds, and cottage cheese, all of which are derived from milk. With this loan, Esmeralda hopes to generate better income.

loans.use: to buy milk for making cheeses, curds, and cottage cheese.

loans.name: Akouewegnigbeto Group

texts.fr: AKOUEWEGNIGBETO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Adjarath(qui a la main levée sur la photo),est âgée de 22 ans et est mariée à un certain Louis. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge. Aucun des enfants n'est scolarisé. Adjarath vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Adjarath n'a jamais été à l'école.Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Adjarath mène comme activité la vente des fruits. Parallèlement à cela Adjarath vend des ustensiles de cuisine. Adjarath s'approvisionne au Bénin.C'est la troisième fois que, Adjarath et les autres membres du groupe AKOUEWEGNIGBETO sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur capacité financière et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AKOUEWEGNIGBETO is a group of three persons who all live together in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Adjarath (who has her hand raised in the photo) is 22  and married to Louis. The couple are raising two children. Neither of the children is enrolled in school. Adjarath  lives together with her husband and children. 

Adjarath never attended school. To support herself and her family, she sells fruit. In addition to that, she sells kitchen utensils. She buys her merchandise in Bénin. This is the third time that Adjarath and the other members of the group called AKOUEWEGNIGBETO are asking for a loan from ALIDé in order to expand their financial capacity and better meet the demand of their clientele. Their first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy fruit, plastics, and coolers.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris, es comerciante, vive con sus dos hijos de 15 y 16 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 13 años, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, actualmente va a invertir en la compra de frutas como fresas, peras, bananos, plátanos, papas.
Esta compra le ayudara para aumentar el negocio, ofreciendo a los clientes frutas y verduras frescas, que le permitan mejorar su servicio y le ayude también a tener mejores ingresos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doris is a merchant and lives with her two children (ages 15 and 16). She has been selling fruits and vegetables for 13 years. Her business is located at the municipal market. At the moment, she plans to invest in the purchase of fruits and produce such as strawberries, pears, bananas, plantains, and potatoes.

This purchase will help increase her business and allow her to offer her customers fresh fruits and vegetables. As a result, Doris will be able to improve her service and generate more income for her children.

loans.use: to buy strawberries, pears, bananas, plantains, and potatoes.

loans.name: Flor Viviana

texts.es: La Sra. Flor es casada, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad; ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tiene su tienda en su casa, ya lleva en el negocio más de un año, eligió este negocio ya que su esposo es mecánico y donde él llegan bastantes transportistas, lo que hace más atractivo su negocio. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abarrotes de primera necesidad (azúcar, arroz, leche entre otros); su principal desafío que enfrenta Flor es el tiempo ya que tiene que compartirlo con el cuidado de su menor hijo y la atención en el negocio; su sueño es tener una gran tienda y ser una de las abastecedoras de la zona. La Sra. Flor está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Flor is married and has a 3-year old son.  She sells basic food items out of her house, and has done so for the past year.  She chose this business since her husband is a mechanic and many drivers come to the house to get work done, making the business viable.  This loan will be used to buy staples such as sugar, rice, milk and other items.  Flor says that her biggest challenge is dividing her time between her son and the business, and dreams of having a larger store one day and becoming one the biggest suppliers in her neighborhood.  She is very grateful for the credit given to her.

loans.use: to buy inventory for store

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with four children, two girls and two boys. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a fried fish business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of purchasing a motor vehicle in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking fat, wheat flour and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking fat, wheat flour and tomatoes.

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dora, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, vive con un hijo de 26 años quien ya está casado, Dora atiende todos los días en el mercado municipal, elaborando pupusas y comida desde has 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella quiere remodelar el negocio, para esto solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en cemento, arena, y demás materiales de construcción, con los que cambiara la imagen, haciendo más atractivo el lugar y a través de esta iniciativa hacer más rentable el negocio.
texts.en:
Dora sells “pupusas”. She lives with her 26-year-old son who is already married. Dora manages her business every day at the municipal market, preparing pupusas and other foods between the hours of 7am and 5pm.

She wants to remodel her business, so she is requesting a loan to invest in cement, sand, and other construction materials in order to change the appearance. By making the place more attractive, Dora will be able to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for remodeling the premises of her business.

loans.name: Haki Sawa Group

texts.en:
Merisian, who is in her late 40s, is married, with one child who goes to school. She has been running a fruits & vegetable business for three years now. She works from 5 am to 7 pm each day and is able to make a very small monthly profit.

This will be her 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase business and paid school fees and household expenses.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to acquire more fruits and vegetables and to continue building her house.  Her dream is to one day be able to finish her house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Haki Sawa", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To add more fruits and vegetables, and to continue building her house.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with one boy and two girls. They live in a house that they own which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a milk business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby.  Umazi faces a major challenge of the lack of a ready market, hence leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business and of purchasing goats and cows. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase a plot of land. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To  purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Ollantay 2 Group

texts.es:
(En la fotografía la socia Nelly está levantando la mano). 

La señora Nelly, tiene 48 años D. edad, nació en la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo (Cusco) y ahora vive en la ciudad del Cusco  del departamento del Cusco, ella radica hace varios años en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Nelly  es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable que atienD. a sus dos hijos, ella para dar D. comer a sus hijos se dedica a la elaboración D. artesanía que consiste en armar muñecas pequeñas, medianas y grandes, ella no tiene un puesto D. venta pero distribuye al por mayor y menor a revendedoras. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Nelly requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo telas, botones, hilos y muchas cosas más. Su sueño D. la socia es abrir una tienda donD. pueD. vender sus productos. 

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Ollantay II” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los demás socios se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo venta D. comestibles, venta D. comida, venta D. papa pelada, venta D. cosméticos y otros brindan servicios D. trasporte D. taxi y mototaxi.   

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly is 48 years old and was born in the city of Ollantaytambo (in the Department of Cusco), but now she lives in the city of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. She relocated to the city of Cusco several years ago and this is where she performs all of her business activities.

Nelly is a hardworking, enterprising, and responsible mother who takes care of her two children. She is able to support them by making crafts, which consists of handmaD. dolls in small, medium, and large sizes. Nelly does not have a vending post, but she distributes her goods in bulk and in smaller amounts to retailers. She has been in this business for 25 years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Nelly is taking this opportunity to request a loan for buying materials such as fabric, buttons, thread, and other items. Her dream is to open a shop where she can sell her products.

(In the photograph, Nelly is the woman who is raising her hand.)

The members of the Communal Bank “Ollantay II” conduct their meetings every thirty days in the city of Cusco. This group consists of hardworking and enterprising individuals who take every moment to look for opportunities to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to proviD. a better future for their children. The members engage in different business activities such as selling food products, selling meals, selling peeled potatoes, selling cosmetics, and providing transportation services using taxis and motorcycle taxis.

Cusco is known for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread, and other materials for making dolls.
